Title: Senior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Tradesy may look like a fashion company, but under the surface we're a micro-economy that runs on data. From product, to marketing, to finance, every department at Tradesy relies on data to make business decisions. As a Senior Data Analyst, you are more than just a person who makes reports. You will be empowered to partner with business owners to investigate issues and recommend solutions to our most pressing challenges.

Part analyst, part project manager, our ideal candidate will be a storyteller who can paint narratives with data as well as divine the true requirements to take a project from conception to completion. The problems you work on will be some of the most pressing to our business; ranging from the supply and demand of our marketplace, to understanding the impact of new product features, to optimizing our marketing and inventory operations.

This role will report into the VP of Data and join a team of analysts, data scientists, and engineers. You will have regular exposure to not just our varied business teams, but also direct access with the executive team, as well as many opportunities for growth.
You Will:
Be an excellent communicator who can drive the full cycle of analytics workflow, from requirement gathering, to data collection, reporting and visualization.
Partner with stakeholders across the company to develop and report on appropriate KPIs and ensure that we’re looking at things in the right way
Identify and analyze trends and shifts in customer behavior, both independently and in collaboration with business stakeholders
Have a keen eye for detail and ensure that numbers always add up
Have strong presentation skills with the ability to create beautiful charts and slide decks
You Have:
4-8 years experience in an analytics or data related role
Excellent SQL and data modeling skills
Fluency with Excel/Google Sheets functions (pivot tables, vlookups, sumifs etc)
Tableau or similar dash-boarding tool experience
Outstanding communication skills and experience presenting to senior management
Bonus Points:
Coding experience in Python
Familiarity with Unix/Linux
Experience implementing web/mobile tracking with Google Tag Manager or Segment
Compensation:
Competitive base salary plus meaningful equity
Comprehensive benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k)
Flexible Paid Time Off
Additional Perks:
Flexible Vacation
Daily catered lunches
Dog friendly office
Weekly yoga
Commuter benefits
Tight knit team

Title: Content Data Scientist, Apple Media Products Data Science
FullDescriptions:
Summary
Posted: Aug 27, 2019
Role Number: 200095659
At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. If you are an ambitious, high-energy individual who is not afraid of challenges, we’re looking for you. Apple is seeking an expert Data Scientist to join a team passionate about Content Data Science & Analytics for Apple Media Products (AMP), covering the App Store, Apple Music/iTunes, Video and other services. This role will involve working with Internet-scale data across numerous product and customer touch points, undertaking in-depth quantitative analysis and building models to drive strategy. The team’s culture is centered around rapid iteration with open feedback and debate along the way, plus strong collaboration with product, engineering, business, and marketing partners.
Key Qualifications
3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst, preferably for an app or digital subscription business. You should have a strong and curious business mindset with an ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action.
Well-versed in SQL languages. Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark preferred, building models for data analytics a plus.
We need familiarity with Python or R and data visualization tools such as Tableau for full-stack data analysis, insight synthesis, and presentation.
Experience using relevant statistical packages to build predictive/ML models.
We value familiarity with A/B test experimentation design.
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail.
We seek someone with excellent time management skills with the ability to lead work to tight deadlines and handle the pressure of executive requests and product launches.
Description
You will dive deep into data to uncover trends identify key insight, and craft machine learning models that will propel the Apple Media content strategy. You will craft how best to monitor, measure and understand performance. You will be collaborating with product, business, marketing, finance and executive teams to generate regular presentations for C-level. You will be partnering with other Apple organizations on data gathering, data governance, evangelizing key performance indicators and democratizing data.
Education & Experience
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics or relevant field. Ideally, Masters in related field.

Title: Business Analyst
FullDescriptions:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Business Analyst is position responsible for identifying data needs and metrics and ensuring the integrity of all data used to support departmental reporting needs.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Effectively translate customer reporting requirements into design documents; conduct report consolidation and validation; use statistical methods to analyze data and generate a useful business report.
Communicate effectively with internal teams and external customers to deliver functional requirements.
Act as a primary liaison between the external sales team and the internal team to ensure the solution aligns to project scope and that it will ultimately meet user needs.
Work with departmental managers to outline the specific data needs for each business method analysis project.
Responsible to verify data accuracy and maintain records or files in accordance with standard procedures and methods; may also assist the team in various projects as needed.
Develop new metrics to assess operational performance. Create, maintain, optimize and support new and existing reports.
ESSENTIAL CORE COMPETENCIES

Strong Excel spreadsheet skills with either professional or academic experience in order to sort, track, compile and report-on large amounts of data effectively
2+ years Data mining experience
4+ years in a data analyst role
Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
Strong attention to detail
Advanced decision making and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. Preferably bilingual in Chinese
EDUCATION

Bachelor Degree (Business with accounting emphasis)

Title: Fraud Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
In this role you will:
Monitor and analyze relevant data to identify and escalate emerging fraud trends on a daily basis
Develop and maintain advanced knowledge of fraud trends, best practices, and relevant technology
Analyze large sets of data to develop new insights into potential fraudulent behavior
Analyze fraud transactions and chargebacks to identify, summarize, communicate and report fraud trends
Manage and maintain fraud strategy by identifying, creating and reviewing fraud rules and processes
Conduct periodic review of rule performance and adjust as needed to ensure maximum efficiency and effectiveness
Take ownership in managing, maintaining and reducing fraud review rates, fraud rates, and chargeback rates at or below industry standards
Work closely with other members of the team to continuously improve internal processes and ensure best practices are followed
Provide analytical training and mentorship for Fraud Analysts, Disputes Analysts, and Fraud Investigators
Maintain effective working relationships across internal and external teams as necessary
Maintain a positive attitude and be willing to adjust daily responsibilities to meet the needs of the business
Must be able to work weekends and non-traditional shifts
We are looking for:
5-8+ years of experience in analytics and modeling, with 3-5 years of experience in e-commerce fraud, risk management or a payments environment
Expert SQL experience required; Python helpful
Ability to think analytically and make informed, accurate decisions
A proven track record of meeting critical deadlines in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
Must be highly organized with a strong attention to detail
Excellent communication and relationship building skills with an ability to prioritize, negotiate, and work with a variety of internal and external stakeholders
Willing (and able) to handle the pressures of an increasing level of responsibility
A quick learner, a self-starter, able to work independently, and comfortable taking initiative while quickly grasping concepts, processes, and ideas
The ability to follow stringent processes and regulations
A self-motivated problem solver who is results oriented and works well within a team-based environment
Strong proficiency working with web browsers and web based tools
GOAT Group is the world’s largest marketplace for authentic sneakers. Its brands offer the greatest selection of sneakers available through company-operated retail stores, e-commerce sites and mobile apps under the GOAT and Flight Club brands. Through its innovative technology and service, GOAT Group has changed the landscape of sneaker commerce and has quickly become the world’s most trusted source to discover, buy and sell authentic sneakers.

The company is backed by strategic investor Foot Locker, Inc. as well as some of the leading names in venture capital including Accel, Andreessen Horowitz, Index Ventures, Matrix Partners, Upfront Ventures, Webb Investment Network and Y Combinator.

GOAT Group will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, if applicable.

FullDescriptions:
Trilogy Education partners with universities to offer programs in Web Development, Data Analytics, UX/UI Design, and Cybersecurity. Our platform combines a market-driven curriculum, robust career services, and a multinational community of universities, instructors, and employers to prepare adult learners for careers in the digital economy.

Our programs have been in existence since 2015, and since then, we've launched an additional 300 classes across the nation. We have hired more than 1,900 Instructors and Teaching Assistants to support our students.

The Job:
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to teach our part time Data Analytics and Visualization class at the University of Southern California. Our instructors are an essential piece to our students experience with us. You must bring a positive attitude and be able to infuse empathy, support, encouragement and fun into the classroom. As an instructor you will need to have the ability to deliver our lesson plans that are being taught across the country; while at the same time, sharing your own professional experiences and industry insight with the students.

Our Data Analytics and Visualization Program:
For too many companies, Big Data isn't the solution to a problem—Big Data is the problem. The Data Analytics and Visualization course provides learners with the knowledge, skills, and expertise to turn data into insights, and into actionable recommendations to improve processes and drive company growth. Starting with Microsoft Excel⎼and advancing through Python, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, API Interactions, Social Media Mining, SQL, Hadoop, Tableau, Advanced Statistics, Machine Learning, R, Git/GitHub, and more⎼students work their way through the industry's most popular programming languages, software, and libraries in data analytics.

Why teach with us?

Are you passionate about education and making an impact? Do you love empowering others to find life-changing opportunities. We'd love to hear from you! If you bring knowledge, strong communication, and a positive energy to the classroom, you're going to help our students along their transformative path to a successful and rewarding career. Prior teaching experience isn't a prerequisite for success as an Instructor or Teaching Assistant within Trilogy.

We'll provide the guidance, training, lesson plans, and tools to support you on your journey of impacting lives in the classroom.

What You Will Do:

Lead lectures and educational coding activities
Answer questions from the stage
Walk around the classroom during coding activities and in-class projects to assist the students, as needed
Ensure Panopto is turned on and actively recording the class lecture to help us continuously improve
Upload all class content to Students Git Repository
Create Homework Assignments in Bootcampspot
Ensure that homework is graded on-time; and occasionally assist with grading

Description

Data analyst skills to determine root cause problems for data integrity and data quality issues identified through QA or by business report owners.

ETL/ELT performance tuning and optimization in Oracle database environment.
Maintenance and support nightly batch schedule.
Support Oracle 11.x and 12.x using PL/SQL, Stored Procedures, Functions and Packages
Leverage best practices, disciplined approaches, and standards to solving technical problems.
Perform ongoing monitoring, optimization, and refinement of reports and BI solutions.

Title: Data Analyst

This role has strong interaction and collaboration across SJHH NSS and Care Integration (NSS Support Services, Claims, Claims Auditing, UM, and CM) operations. Manage the flow of scheduled reports to ensure customer deadlines and health plan Audit compliance requirements are met.

In this position you will have the following responsibilities:

Develop ad-hoc reports and analysis dashboards for business users and reporting mechanisms that help to ensure the integrity of the Audit Information, MTR, Medicare Interest Rate, Forward to Health Plan Charts, care integration reporting activities, etc.

Collaborate and assist director, managers, and business analyst within the NSS operations and Care Integration in identifying, troubleshooting, remediating, and resolving issues related to Claims Compliance and Utilization Management.
Cooperate fully in all risk management activities and investigations.
Treat all information and data within the scope of the position with complete confidentiality and security. Need to maintain all practices to protect PHI and follow HIPAA guidelines.

Required qualifications for this position include:
Associate's Degree or a High School Diploma/GED with two (2) years relevant experience in field directly related to reporting and data analysis may be substituted to meet the educational requirements.

One (1) years’ experience supporting users with reporting requirements.
One (1) year of audit and compliance experience.

Recent experience working with Claims and Utilization Management related data.
Accurate data entry skills.

Two (2) plus years’ experience in compiling reports in a Healthcare related business, preferably a health plan environment.
Two (2) plus years’ experience supporting users with reporting requirements.
Two (2) plus years’ experience in a healthcare organization working with health plan and/or government regulations.

Title: LAHSA Internship Program
Skills:
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong research and analytical skills.
Exceptional organizational and administrative abilities.
Innovation, critical thinking and creative problem solving.
Demonstrated maturity to work in a professional and fast paced environment.
Proficiency using the MS Office Suite.
FullDescriptions:
Overview
One of the best ways to learn the about the work in policies, programs and services around for people experiencing homelessness is through an internship program. LAHSA is looking for bright, self-motivated, energetic individuals who are interested in learning the dynamics of working in a government agency. Through this program, students are involved in meaningful, productive work while energizing our organization with fresh ideas. While students can gain credit hours to apply towards their education and licensing, internships are also a great recruiting tool that allows LAHSA to train potential future employees.

Our internship program runs year-round depending upon availability of projects, resources and need. Both paid and un-paid internships are available. Paid internships will be advertised and recruited individually, with scope and stipend listed within the employment classification.

LAHSA strives to keep the local community connected with the work taking place throughout the continuum. This is accomplished through community-based events, policy advocacy, correspondence and everyday involvement with the Los Angeles Continuum of Care (CoC). As an intern you may provide support to staff with special events, policy and research, program design, homeless programs and services, and special projects related to the mission of reducing homelessness. The goal is to establish a workable and mutually beneficial learning environment.

The internship program is designed to help students develop knowledge and understanding of the common principles, functions and practices related to working in a public agency. Although unpaid, interns receive important benefits like working directly with staff, elected officials, and community leaders on issues and events related homelessness in additional to gaining valuable skills and experience in the professional work environment. Interns may also qualify for educational credit from their college or university.

Session Duration Deadline to Apply Hours Per Week
A January - April November 10 10 - 20
B May - August March 10 10 - 20
C September - December June 10 10 - 20

Department Descriptions

Access & Engagement
The Access & Engagement Department provides outreach services and emergency assistance to people who are homeless or at risk of experiencing homelessness in the City and County of Los Angeles. The Access & Engagement department includes our Homeless Engagement Teams (HETs) which respond to requests from a variety of sources (i.e., Los Angeles City Mayor's Office, City Council Districts, and Los Angeles County Supervisor Districts and County Departments) and has staff co-located across the County.

Our HETs conduct outreach at any location where people experiencing homelessness reside including streets, alleys, parks and riverbeds. Outreach is primarily directed with identifying homeless people who might not use services, due to lack of awareness or active avoidance, and who otherwise might be ignored or underserved.

Communications
The Communications Department is responsible for the official messaging from the Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority (LAHSA). Five key functions include: Internal communications, external communications, social media, speaker training and communications to providers. The department manages all media inquiries, press releases, media events, public relations, website management, social media, tracking LAHSA and homelessness in the news, development and production of all printed materials. Using traditional methods of communication (e.g. press releases, media events, printed materials) in combination with new media tools (e.g. internet, e-mail, social media) the department supports LAHSA's mission in all communications.

Finance
The Finance Department is responsible for managing all LAHSA financial reporting and compliance requirements. These activities include the review and processing of over 100 monthly requests for funding from the Housing Urban Development (HUD), Health and Human Services (HHS), County and City funders; review and processing of monthly service provider requests for payment for approximately 300 provider contracts; annual financial closeouts for all funding agreements and service provider contracts; management of fiscal compliance on-site monitoring of 300 agency-sponsored programs; oversight and payment of all LAHSA administrative expenses, including payroll; oversight of LAHSA's annual financial audit; and preparation and submission of LAHSA's budgets to both the City and County of Los Angeles.

Human Resources and Administration
The Human Resources and Administration Department is responsible for providing an organizational framework to recruit, compensate, professionally develop, support and retain LAHSA's diverse workforce while ensuring an environment that optimizes productivity, efficiency, and effectiveness. This includes benefits administration, employee relations, regulatory and State and Federal labor law compliance. The administrative functions of the department include directing and managing internal administration, facilities operations and vendor relations, fleet management, and management and monitoring of meeting compliance for the Commission and its sub-Committees. The department, under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer, ensures that operations are efficient and effective for both LAHSA personnel and the Board of Commissioners.

Information Technology (IT)
The Information Technology Department oversees the management, development, networking and maintenance of all LAHSA IT systems, server infrastructure, software, data storage and telecommunications. The IT department is also responsible for the design and upkeep of the LAHSA websites as well as the development of custom in-house applications in support of LAHSA's operations.

Policy & Systems
The Policy & Systems Department cultivates and supports systematic initiatives that end homelessness through efficient policy development and effective engagement of community partners. The Policy and Systems department is also responsible for conducting the HUD-mandated biannual Homeless Count, which is an enumeration of the Continuum of Care (CoC)'s homeless population. Additionally, this department, in conjunction with the Programs department, compiles a significant portion of the annual Notice of Funding Availability (NOFA) application, through which the CoC receives over $105 mm in federal McKinney-Vento funding for homeless services.
Units in this department include: Policy & Legislative Affairs, Systems Coordination, Community Engagement.
Unit Core Functions:
Policy & Legislative Affairs: Analyze, develop, and coordinate policies that ensure homelessness is rare, brief, and non-reoccurring Coordinated Entry System (CES) Policy Development, Legislative/Policy Analysis, Governance.
Systems Coordination: Drives, integrates, and coordinates system resources to ensure an efficient delivery of services that end people's experience of homelessness, oversees the functions and performance of the Coordinated Entry System (CES), assesses existing gaps through strategic planning and development ensuring collaborative integration with existing non-LAHSA systems.
Community Engagement: Builds ongoing, permanent relationships with and between community partners to harness Los Angeles' ability to collectively end homelessness. Also oversees and executes annual Greater Los Angeles Homeless Count, coordinates, educates, and communicates on homelessness via information sessions and updates at community and public meetings. Provides for the development and maintenance of relationships with homeless coalitions, persons with lived experience, neighborhood councils, faith-based, advocates, local governments, and other civic groups

Procurement & Performance Management
The Procurement & Performance Management Department is responsible for procurement and funding administration, contract compliance, tracking agency performance through program outcomes and day-to-day contract management. Collectively, these functions entail issuing Request for Proposal (RFP)s and evaluating proposals, conducting agency site and desk monitoring, as well as extensively corresponding with agency partners regarding their LAHSA contracts. Additionally, this department tracks agency and programs' outcomes through the Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) database, and is responsible for submitting this data to HUD. The Procurement & Performance Management department also, in conjunction with the Policy and Systems department, compiles a significant portion of the annual Notice of Funding Availability (NOFA) application, through which the CoC receives over $105 mm in federal McKinney-Vento funding for homeless services.
Unit Functions:
Procurement Unit: Manages Request for Statement of Qualifications (RFSQ) process, develops Requests for Proposals (RFP), Request for Bids, Requests for Information/Interest, and manages all procurement processes for LAHSA homeless housing and related services programs.
Purchasing, Contracts & Grants Unit: Provides guidance on purchasing policies, and develops unified processes, tools and training designed to optimize LAHSA's use and administration of Public Funds. Prepares Contract & Grant Agreement Templates for legal counsel approval. Prepares, transmits and supports funded agencies in executing all LAHSA subrecipient agreements, leads the LAHSA Integrated Agency Support Team (IAST) process.
Performance Management Unit: Monitors program-level Contract Management activities, including spend down and outcomes performance, monthly interface with funded programs and Technical Assistance plans when necessary.
System Components Unit: Manages the System Components oversight of system components, e.g.: Rapid Re-Housing (RRH), Permanent Supportive Housing (PSH), Navigation, etc., and leads regular learning communities for providers by component type. Communicates best practices and guidance to agencies, ongoing management of Scope of Required Services for each funded component.
Quality & Special Projects Unit: Processes and resolves grievances, assess and ensures LAHSA is Americans with Disability Act (ADA) compliant through quality assurance. Responsible for ongoing project management and new program implementation.

Data Management
The Data Management Department is responsible for the governance and analysis of data collected in the Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) and through the Homeless Count. The department also provides direction and support on data-related initiatives, business intelligence, data automation and reporting to assist in the development and implementation of strategic initiatives to ensure effective and efficient systems of care for all people experiencing homelessness in LA City and County.
There are three units within this department: Performance Analysis and Reporting (PAR), Data and Research, and Homeless Management Information System (HMIS).
Unit Core Functions:
Performance Analysis and Reporting Unit: The Performance Analysis and Reporting Unit meets all programmatic reporting requirements and creates tools for ongoing program and system performance evaluation, including strategic initiatives, like dashboards. The team also assists in the development of RFPs and collaborates with internal and external experts to determine performance targets. PAR contributes to a wide range of efforts in the organization, touching virtually every department and business unit.
Data and Research Unit: The unit guides research to support policy priorities and analysis of the annual homeless count and housing inventory. Data and Research also manages the ongoing research and evaluation agenda and research partnerships, spatial and systemic analysis, particularly through use of GIS mapping, performance analysis and reporting.
Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) Unit: The unit, which is comprised of Data Analyst, Training & Technical Support, and Report Development Teams, is multifaceted, managing all aspects of operating the LA Continuum of Care (CoC) HMIS, including system configuration, monitoring the integrity and quality of HMIS data, providing training and technical oversight, and overseeing the development of HMIS report and business intelligence tools, from ideation to publication.

Essential Job Functions
Sample Job Functions:
Tasks and projects related to the assigned department.
Policy research and development.
Legal, contracts and procurement research and analysis.
Standard office and administrative functions.
Preparation of letters, reports and spreadsheets.
Work on ad-hoc committees, boards and other internal meetings.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Desired Skills:
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong research and analytical skills.
Exceptional organizational and administrative abilities.
Innovation, critical thinking and creative problem solving.
Demonstrated maturity to work in a professional and fast paced environment.
Proficiency using the MS Office Suite.
Training & Experience
Candidates must be enrolled in an educational program upon the start of your internship and have an interest in the following areas: public policy, finance, urban planning, data management and outcomes assessments, procurement and funding, public relations, client engagement, grievance and compliance, or a similar area of study or career path. Students must have a genuine concern for assisting our most vulnerable populations and be passionate about enriching people's lives. Candidates must reside or attend a school in Los Angeles County.

Title: Senior Forensic Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Senior Forensic Data Analyst to join our winning team, located in our Global Services Office in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

The Senior Forensic Data Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.

As a Senior Forensic Data Analyst at Latham, you will be responsible for the configuration of the EnCase platform and collection templates as well as conducting tasks related to the forensic examination and collection of electronic files from file servers, desktop and laptop computers, media, including hard drives, flash drives, and cellular devices. You will provide support to senior level team members to develop standards, procedures and evolve the forensic data services through various improvement initiatives as well as recommend strategies for data collection, imaging, data analysis, and reporting. You will be responsible for planning, deployment, testing, and administration of forensic applications, upgrades, and software patches. You will work closely with other members of the Technology teams to examine and acquire internal firm data for processing, review, and analysis using industry leading forensic technologies, while accomplishing these and other critical functions:

Planning, designing, and deploying collection templates, procedures and workflow to support firm processes for internal document review, release of client files and other related projects.
Working closely with other members of Technology, including the Messaging team, Security staff, Practice Support Services and Information Governance to advise on forensic capabilities and ensure forensic tools communicate correctly with various electronic repositories.
Working with senior members of the Practice Support Services (PSS) team to develop procedures, workflows and the automation of tasks to streamline the lifecycle of data from collection through review and production.
Collaborating with network staff to ensure smooth and reliable operation of software and systems for fulfilling business objectives and processes.
Overseeing the development of new processes and installation of EnCase application upgrades and new modules.
Seeking opportunities where forensic tools can add value and/or improve existing processes such as capturing departed employee data, monitoring, assisting with other Information Governance and/or Security team projects etc.
Understanding and anticipating the needs of the PSS team, attorneys, and other internal clients with respect to forensic software, tools and collection methodologies. Conducting research and making recommendations to the PSS management team regarding same.
Serving as a high-level escalation point and providing troubleshooting assistance, application support and training to PSS members, and/or Information Governance, Records and internal clients as needed.
Creating and managing jobs within the EnCase platform for the imaging, acquisition, extraction, processing and delivery of data from various sources including hard drives, flash drives, network directories, email and other repositories.
Liaising with other team members, including Practice Support Services, Information Governance and Records to ensure data is collected according to project requirements.


As a Senior Forensic Data Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Senior Forensic Data Analyst must have experience with forensic techniques and the most commonly used forensic toolsets, including EnCase Enterprise, EnCase eDiscovery, Tableau Writeblockers and Imagers, and encryption tools. The ideal candidate will have strong operational skills with the use of EnCase, and the ability to perform forensic data acquisition/collection in support of forensic investigations and electronic discovery matters. The Analyst will have a strong mastery of data collection, preservation, and chain of custody principles and procedures, an understanding of file systems, various computer hardware, and computer networking concepts. The ideal candidate should have knowledge of and proficiency in the use of batch files and proprietary tools for the management and manipulation of files and data (i.e. TextPad, UltraEdit, NotePad++, Power Shell, VB scripts, Beyond Compare, TreeSize Professional, Bulk-Rename Utility, Adobe Acrobat, Transcend Migrator, VeraCrypt, SnagIT, iConvert, etc). He or she should have an understanding of law-based concepts surrounding jurisdictionally restricted data and appropriate workflows to employ with such matters.

A Bachelor’s Degree is required. Eight (8) years of directly relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. A minimum of six (6) years of practice support and IT experience are required.


Travel and working after-hours may be required.


Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.

FullDescriptions:
GENERAL SUMMARY:

We are hiring for a Data Analyst, Consultant on the Medi-Cal Encounter Analytics team within the Actuarial Department. This position will conduct in-depth analysis to ensure the quality of claims/encounter data submitted to regulatory entities. This position will need to work closely with multiple departments, be able to rapidly understand and navigate new situations, and be able to create solutions on the go.


In order to create an effective team, nearly every single individual on the team needs to be extraordinarily strong in their technical background with the ability to learn quickly. The analyst will be part of a team that is leading and developing new programs and new processes.
In addition to strong technical skills, this position will require the soft communication skills to be able to articulate complex concepts to individuals lacking in a technical background.

This position may provide support towards eventual attainment of the Associate or Fellow, Society of Actuaries (SOA) designation, if desired.


Qualifications

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ensure complete and accurate submission of supplemental data to regulatory entities.
Develop tracking reports and actionable metrics to improve quality of claims/encounter data.

Work with cross-functional teams to meet objectives.
Mentor lower-level analysts. Responsible for peer review of reporting accuracy.
Special projects as requested.

Healthcare claims knowledge.

Title: Data Analyst - INT
FullDescriptions:
Location: Pasadena, CA

Position Description: Provide data architectural leadership in developing enterprise data/process models, and logical/physical database designs. Provide data and database development, maintenance, and production support. Participate in IT and Business project to define system requirements. Experience Level: 3-6 Years. Skill Set: Business analysis. Business process modeling - enterprise to department level. Ability to interpret Entity Relationship Diagrams.

SUMMARY The primary focus of this position is to build logical datasets from various sources, build/augment reporting functionality, develop systematic processes to routinely maintain and update data, and reduce variation across reporting platforms. BUSINESS ANALYST SKILLS - Translates business and technical needs, issues, and ideas into effective strategies and action plans. - Elicits detailed business requirements and builds effective, data driven and analytical solutions to meet requirements (requires SQL, SAS, and integration from data from multiple db/file formats) - Formulates specific implementation plans and evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented. - Communicates results/recommendations to project sponsors, clients, and various management-level audiences - Participates in the development of process improvements and related outcomes - Works closely with business, and IT. - Very strong analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team. - Experience with provider demographic data. TECHNICAL SKILLS - Experience with analytical manipulation and interpretation of large databases required. - Designs and enhances databases and alternative solutions. - Designs systems that are effective and user-friendly. - Conducts data analysis and develops reports with accurate, easy to read, useful information. - Designs and manages data quality tracking and monitoring tools. - Validates and maintains data integrity across multiple databases and data sources (SQL, internal SAS, DB2, VSAM; external: Adobe, Excel, SAS parsing routines, COBOL). - Builds and maintains statistical routines using macros, vendor software, and software written by self and others. Top 3-5 Daily Responsibilities: 1. Identify business requirements for provider network data reporting needs; develop systematic/programmatic solutions based on business requirements. 2. Optimize existing database used to collect provider demographic data; design and implement additional existing databases, based on data management needs. 3. Identify solution options for more systematic intake of provider demographic data changes and updates. Top 3-5 Required Skills: 1. Strong skills in SQL, SAS programming languages. 2. Demonstrated experience in gathering business requirements and execution of report and query design. 3. Experience with MS Access. 4. Ability to synthesize complex business/report requirements and connect them across efforts to anticipate reporting needs. Desired Skills: 1. Experience with developing/implementing SQL Server solutions. Soft Skills: 1. Strong written and verbal communication skills; demonstrated work experience with both business and technical teams. 2. Values teamwork; listens/responds constructively to needs of team members and stakeholders. 3. Demonstrates flexibility and openness to changes (sometimes last-minute) that need to be made in work products.

FullDescriptions:
Req ID: 30176
Location: LAO
Other Location(s): Los Angeles (CA)
Experience Level: Professional

At Capital, we’re committed to providing you with opportunities to broaden and deepen your knowledge and skills, and to grow personally, professionally and financially. If you’re interested in continuing to Grow with Capital by pursuing a new role, please review the job description below to determine if this opportunity might be right for you.

For additional information about how you can develop your career at Capital, please visit Grow with Capital.

At Capital, how we work is defined by shared values that include absolute integrity, respect and collaboration. But it's more than that. It's smart and highly driven people united in purpose to server our investors and one another. Bring your energy and unique perspective to Capital and you'll have the opportunity to grow with us professionally, personally, and financially. You'll be a part of a team that genuinely cares about helping you succeed. You'll work alongside talented colleagues, many of whom build long careers while progressing through multiple roles, establishing lifelong friendships and making a difference in our communities. In return for your contributions, you'll receive premier compensation and benefits, and a company-funded retirement plan that ranks amongst the most generous.

Information & Insights, a department within Capital Group’s Investment Operations, delivers a comprehensive set of data capabilities that enable Capital Group's investment data strategy. Our Data Solutions teams are focused on implementing that data strategy to enable the full range of business objectives: data for minimizing risk, data for efficient processes, and data for growth and innovation. We also deploy a set of capabilities to source, automate, and curate data assets. This enables and enriches core investment and distribution processes, reporting, analysis, and advanced analytics efforts. Data is a strategic focus for Capital Group and exciting transformations are underway.

As a Senior Investment Data Analyst based in Los Angeles, you will play an integral role in providing technical thought leadership across multiple teams and strategic investment management related data initiatives. You will serve as one of the principle relationship owners between our business and technology partners. You will lead engagements that align data solutions to enterprise standards, industry best practices, and business needs. You will act as a hands-on leader and expert who possess the ability to shift between a technical and business context.

Responsibilities:

Provide guidance and prioritize data requirements within a business unit
Evaluate new and alternative data sources and new data integration techniques
Guide and direct offshore contractors on assignments
Enable new product launches and updates to existing strategies
Ensure content in critical 3rd party data platforms are up to date and accurate
Plan, contribute, and sign off on user acceptance tests for production deployments
Proactively communicate with marketing, sales, and consultant relationship managers
Analyze trends in product searches and provide insight to sales teams
Work with complex data structures and provide innovative ways to solution for complex data delivery requirements
Establish standards for documentation and ensure your team adheres to those standards
Stay current with industry trends on data automation and visualization tools
Influence and develop a thorough understanding of standards and best practices used by your team

Qualifications:

6+ years of experience with business intelligence, reporting, and data transformation
Experience and knowledge of the asset management industry and investment data: portfolio characteristics, performance, and other metrics
Experience with MorningStar, eVestment, Mercer and other investment data platforms highly preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated experience in translating unstructured business problems into clearly defined requirements framework
Demonstrated experience in leading projects across multiple teams
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Information Technology or other quantitative field required
Knowledge of SQL and database design
Demonstrated experience using reporting/data visualization tools such as Tableau, SSRS, etc.
Demonstrated ability to test software and ensure that project solutions align to requirements

Company Overview:
Founded in 1931, Capital Group is one of the world’s largest and most trusted investment management companies and home to the American Funds. We manage more than US$1.7 trillion in assets, and our 7,500 associates make our clients their first priority every day. When we do our job right, millions of investors around the world fulfill their dreams and financial goals, from home ownership and higher education, to a comfortable retirement. Our long-term investment results and outstanding service set us apart from our competitors, while our workplace sets us apart from other employers.

We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Title: Clinical Data Analyst III
FullDescriptions:
Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in five health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.

Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.

Job Summary
The Senior Clinical Data Analyst supports Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set (HEDIS), quality and process improvement activities by producing healthcare outcome measurements that are used for internal and external reporting, the tasks including data quality assurance, process programming, specification documentation and report developing.
The Senior Clinical Data Analyst applies technical skills to design, develop, and generate HEDIS production and similar reports that may evolve into complex data analysis/data integration projects that this individual may be responsible for maintaining. The complex data analysis/integration projects are those which may require periodic maintenance on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, biannual, or annual basis. This position works with Information Systems analysts when ongoing reports can be accurately transferred for production.
This position interprets and documents both written and verbal specifications. This position takes basic instructions or specifications and interviews with the client for complete details sufficient for writing data queries based for ad hoc and ongoing health care measures. This position must comprehend the relationships between the field elements in encounters and claims, membership, and provider databases.
This position is a key resource to the Quality Performance Management (QPM) department on application use. This position supports the functions related to quality improvement activities inclusive of quarterly reports that demonstrate health care outcomes in comparison to targets or national averages/percentiles published by recognized organizations such as National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) and Center for Disease Control (CDC).

Duties
Design, develop and maintain complex ongoing data projects. Design, develop, and generate ad hoc/production reports. Produce automatic, robust, timely and accurate results based on client specifications and as allowed by available resources. Produce complete documentation, QC reports and periodic results as scheduled. Identify and create work-around to generate valid results that meet the intent of the client's specifications.
Investigate and document organizational data flow and sources. Provide thorough documentation regarding current 1) data sources 2) data flow 3) current process and procedures to code, group, QC, link and seed the data. Develop automatic, robust and sharable Statistical Analysis System (SAS) or Structured Query Language (SQL) procedures and programs towards building a comprehensive clinical data repository.
Develop analytical programs, databases, routine procedures using SAS or SQL programming language. Create work tools that facilitate tasks by reducing paperwork and errors. Document assumptions, specification in a clear and sharable fashion.
Educate/Tutor clients/junior staff on maintenance/usage of database/solutions designed. Educate/Tutor junior staff on data/business knowledge and technical skills.
Communicate with stakeholders/clients/collaborators regarding project details and plans.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Education

Required: Bachelor's Degree

Preferred: Master's Degree in Public Health, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Health Sciences, Quantitative Social Sciences, Statistics, Information Systems.
Equivalent: In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered.

Experience
Required: A minimum of 5 years of experience on reports/analyses in HEDIS or risk adjustment.

Skills
Required:
Must be able to apply and/or develop technical specifications for health care measures such as those used by National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA), HEDIS, Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), and State.
Must demonstrate advanced SAS skills in developing programs and procedures for analytics and quality assurance. Working knowledge of SAS Proc SQL, SAS Macro and database related SAS skills are highly preferred.
Must be able to present data in a format that is appropriate for analysis. This includes the ability to determine select the correct information for calculating basic rates, table configuration, and graphical presentations.
Must demonstrate an aptitude in learning and expanding abilities to use new applications with basic training.
Must be a self-starter and can multi-task and can take charge of assigned projects.
Must be able to make recommendations to the clients that demonstrate strengths and limitations of the organization's ability to meet the request.
Licenses/Certifications Preferred
Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA)
Statistical Analysis System (SAS) Certification
L.A. Care offers a wide range of benefits including
Paid Time Off (PTO)
Tuition Reimbursement
Retirement Plans
Medical, Dental and Vision
Wellness Program
Volunteer Time Off (VTO)

Technical/quantitative major (math, stats, comp sci, engineering, economics...) or relevant experience
Strong problem-solving skills. Deals well with ambiguity
Self-driven and detailed oriented
1 year programming experience with Python using the Pandas library
Proficient with SQL, and Unix operating systems
FullDescriptions:
Overview
Founded in 1973, Inter-Con Security Systems, Inc. is a leading US-owned security company, providing a full range of physical security services to government and commercial customers on four continents. Inter-Con (ICS) provides custom client solutions tailored to quality with the flexibility to operate in highly complex environments. The firm specializes in providing tailored services to clients whose needs exceed the sophistication and expertise of traditional guard firms. Inter-Con remains under family ownership and control and operates as the industry leader in the field of customized, high-requirement security solutions. Inter-Con employs over 25,000 security personnel world-wide, trained and managed by a team of professionals with unsurpassed military, law enforcement, and security experience.
Inter-Con is Everywhere Security Matters

Job Description
Inter-Con is currently hiring a Data Analyst for Security Operations reporting to the Chief Administration Officer. The analyst will work closely with financial analysts, software developers and database architects on various data initiatives.

Primary Responsibilities
1) Gather and process raw data from internal and external sources (including writing scripts, scraping, and calling APIs, etc.) to derive business insights using predictive analytics
2) Collaborate with data engineers to build data pipelines and infrastructure
3) Design, develop, and implement proprietary tools and data models to support operational productivity and performance
4) Develop and maintain web portals and dashboards utilizing WordPress, Google office suite, Airflow, AWS and other platforms as needed
5) Query, transform, and integrate data from multiple sources and structures to optimize business insights and propose solutions for Inter-Con's development of best-in-class business products and services
6) Create, update, and enhance statistical models and dashboards via Python and Google Data Studio for ongoing and ad-hoc reporting
7) Construct time series and machine learning models to create predictive insights in relation to Inter-Con's resource management, operations, and business services (e.g. analysis of cold-starts for client retention)
8) Collaborate with data engineers to define requirements and enhancements for ongoing reliability and scalability of the Inter-Con data platform as a service.
9) Simplify complex data problems and create elegant solutions that enable business partners to tell the Inter-Con data story through business intelligence and data-driven product innovation
10) Collaborate and work closely with other departments to identify gaps and structure problems and create actionable strategies
11) Monitor trends in data science and alternative sources to ensure the use of best in class tools and techniques
12) Ad-hoc data projects as assigned

Qualifications
Technical/quantitative major (math, stats, comp sci, engineering, economics...) or relevant experience
Strong problem-solving skills. Deals well with ambiguity
Self-driven and detailed oriented
1 year programming experience with Python using the Pandas library
Proficient with SQL, and Unix operating systems


Experience with any of the following is a plus:
Salesforce platform and API, Paycom API, Sharepoint API
AirFlow, Jupyter Notebooks, Web Development (Flask/Django/Dash)
Google Data Studio or other Business Intelligence tools, Google Cloud and AWS

Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Inter-Con Security Systems, Inc. is an affirmative action employer who provides equal employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans, and disabled individuals, as well as other protected groups. License PPO 6822

Title: Manager, eCommerce Key Accounts
FullDescriptions:
US Digital, Coty Professional Beauty

COTY, Calabasas, CA, US

PURPOSE

Our purpose is to celebrate and liberate the diversity of beauty. We challenge convention through invention, expanding our horizons to enrich your reality with possibility. We build brands to inspire and enable our consumers to experience the confidence and joy of expressing their beauty, their way.

MISSION AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The Manager will oversee the business relationship of Amazon and other national e-retailers while growing sales / consumption to meet company goals and objectives.

Key Responsibilities:
Reviewing company reports to build an understanding of customer objectives and direction
Planning, developing, agreeing and implementing an annual joint business plan with Amazon and other national e-tailers
Monitoring and reviewing business plans with your customer and e-Data Analyst, and activating contingency plans when needed
Managing sales forecasts and investment plans, and providing weekly estimates on sales projections
Designing an annual promotional program for each brand across all platforms
Liaising with our Shopper Marketing team and other cross-functional teams to deliver national marketing plans, achieve sales objectives and meet customer and consumer needs
Maximizing the commercial value of the consumer insight data from ARA Premium and Google Analytics
Agreeing promotional forecasts and monthly promotional support packages with Demand Planning
Reviewing promotional activity analysis to maximize key learnings
Fostering relationships with customers’ forecasting and supply chain teams
Developing strategic plans to build specified categories of business to deliver company, customer and consumer objectives
Lead and build capability of management team to execute the perfect store and customer experience.
Liaising with media agencies and brand teams to align on sufficiency plans and execution of key market activities and initiatives
Prospect and manage new 3rd party marketplace opportunities and relationships

QUALIFICATIONS

Expert level of selling on Amazon marketplace/ Seller Central/ Vendor Central or other key marketplace customers with extensive knowledge of best practices and strategies
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Management or other relevant study
2 years+ experience in consumer or professional goods, Beauty/Fashion industry a plus
Ability to multi-task and work efficiently in an extremely fast-paced environment and manage time effectively
Results-driven and able to work with the cross-function teams to achieve sales
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, self- starter, and be able to work independently. Strategic thinker.
Ability to travel up to 1x per month/quarter, as needed
Core Competencies

Strategic Planning
Analysis, particularly in Microsoft Excel and/or SQL
Project Management
Relationship Management
Process Improvement
Business Development

We are Coty – and our people make us who we are.

It’s important that we find individuals who are a great fit for our business, not just for us but for you too. We want people to thrive here and, if you are the right culture fit with us and we with you, you’ll be able to shine and achieve beyond your own expectations.

For us, beauty is and beauty does. We are very focused because we all want the same thing: to help our consumers celebrate and liberate the diversity of their beauty – and that takes creativity, excellence and radical thinking – we are here to disrupt the beauty industry on behalf of consumers and you need to want to join that mission to succeed here.
We have an energetic intensity about us. We’re quite relentless in our determination to deliver, always accountable for our actions and tenacious. We will not be beaten by obstacles.
Responding quickly with agile thinking to business challenges and opportunities is second nature to us. We like it that way as it means we can be creative and find new ways to make things happen fast. Colleagues will expect it of you and you’ll expect it of them – we’re a team and we help each other. We’re all in it together – irrespective of level or part of the business.
We always go the extra mile, pushing the boundaries to be that best partner we can be to our customers and to excite and delight our consumers.
When you join Coty, you become part of a vibrantly diverse and energetic group who have fun in an intense sort of way. Because we’re not just here for the ride, we want to change things.
INTERESTED?

Interested in this opportunity? Please send your application to [First Name] at AAA_BBB@cotyinc.com

ABOUT US

Coty’s purpose is to celebrate and liberate the diversity of our consumers’ beauty. Aligned to this is our mission – to strive over time to become the global industry leader by being the clear challenger in beauty, delighting consumers and creating long term shareholder value.

We are one of the world’s largest beauty companies with approximately $9 billion in revenue, and our strong entrepreneurial heritage has created an iconic portfolio of leading beauty brands.

As the global leader in fragrance, a strong number two in professional salon hair color & styling, and number three in color cosmetics, we operate across three divisions:

Coty Consumer Beauty: focused on color cosmetics, retail hair coloring and styling products, body care and mass fragrances sold primarily in the mass retail channels with brands such as COVERGIRL, Max Factor and Rimmel
Coty Luxury: focused on prestige fragrances and skincare with brands such as Calvin Klein, Marc Jacobs, Hugo Boss, Gucci and philosophy
Coty Professional Beauty: focused on servicing salon owners and professionals in both hair and nail with brands such as Wella Professionals, Sebastian Professional, OPI and ghd
Coty is a truly global player with over 20,000 employees, operations in more than 40 countries in Asia, Latin America, Australia, Middle East and Africa, as well as Europe and North America and products sold in over 130 countries and territories. Our headquarters are in London, New York, Geneva and Paris.

Want to know more?

For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit www.coty.com.

At Coty, we embrace Diversity. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability.

Title: Data Analyst – F2P
Skills:
2+ years of experience in a business intelligence/analysis role, with a proven track record of delivering high profile, business focused analytics solutions in a fast-paced environment
Be able to capture requirements from business stakeholders; interpret and articulate their requirements to development teams
Skills to perform technical data analysis (SQL, querying tools, etc)
Strong data insight presentation skills, with mastery of Excel functions (to include: VLOOKUP, COUNTIFS, INDIRECT, INDEX/OFFSET, etc), knowledge/experience with Tableau,
Working knowledge of implementing forecasted trend lines (linear, logarithmic, moving average, etc) in the tools mentioned above
Strong business acumen, and a keen understanding of the KPI drivers for the differing business models now common place in the video games market
Ability to work effectively and professionally with cross-functional teams worldwide
Meticulous attention to detail, and have the ability to make good, timely decisions
Ability to multitask and context switch between low level detail and the ‘bigger picture’
Motivated, organized self-starter with a flair for problem-solving
Excellent written/verbal communication & facilitation skills
A passion for gaming and personal gaming experience, preferably free-to-play
Responsibilities:
Work closely with Product Management and Production to ensure the team has the proper information to make the right product and business decisions

Improvement of player engagement & retention
User acquisition effectiveness
Optimization of game economies
Drive monetization (through new revenue streams & promotional strategies)
Data-mine product player bases to provide both qualitative & quantitative context to issues identified by Customer Support, Quality Assurance & Community Management functions
Manage and prioritize request backlog for your specific titles

You will be responsible for all aspects of Business Intelligence for one or more free-to-play titles at 505 Games. You will be looked at to drive insights and recommendations based on data to the product, marketing, design and production teams for your game(s). You will be accountable for all aspects of metrics tracking and analysis for each title, from the conceptualization of data models necessary to track the various business KPIs, deep diving into these data sets to provide insights, to predictive modelling and forecasting of future performance. This is a critical role for the Free-to-Play team as 505 Games is data-driven organization.

Meticulous attention to detail, and have the ability to make good, timely decisions
Ability to multitask and context switch between low level detail and the ‘bigger picture’
Motivated, organized self-starter with a flair for problem-solving
Excellent written/verbal communication & facilitation skills
A passion for gaming and personal gaming experience, preferably free-to-play

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who will help shape the company's marketing strategy by providing business insights, campaign analysis, consumer research, and data mining into what makes our customers tick. You will become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the health of the consumer-facing business lines, helping to spot anomalies and opportunities. This position reports to the Vice President of Consumer Marketing.

Responsibilities


Develop and track all key business metrics (sales, churn, ARPU) to identify key trends and opportunities for optimization. Provide weekly reporting to the Executive team.
Based on data sets, spot anomalies that are the result of bugs/billing issues/outages, and serve as the primary Marketing team member to work with Engineering to ensure they are resolved.
Develop profitability analysis of all our consumer product lines
Query and manipulate large data sets to create customer profiles and associated marketing strategies
Develop and track all needed customer, channel and competitive data and analyses
Implement consumer research as necessary
Assist in the annual budgeting and monthly re-forecasting process

Is This You?


You have a Bachelors degree in Business, Finance (or related major); MBA a plus.
You have a minimum of five years of experience in data-intensive marketing, business, or financial analytics role.
You have outstanding statistical, quantitative modeling and forecasting skills.
Demonstrated business analysis skills, including sales planning and analysis, sales forecasting, Customer Lifetime Value (LTV) analysis, campaign tracking and analysis, and consumer research
Experience working with standard clickstream analysis and business intelligence tools such as Google Analytics, Splunk, Tableau, Looker, and Business Objects
Strong knowledge of SQL required; other programming languages a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Quick learner with proven ability to operate in a fluid, fast-paced environment
Must be able to work some evenings and weekends as required to fulfill business and operating plans

Meet Boingo

Boingo Wireless, Inc. (NASDAQ: WIFI) helps the world stay connected. Our vast footprint of Wi-Fi and cellular networks covers more than a million locations and reaches over a billion consumers annually – in places as varied as airports, stadiums, military bases, and multifamily communities. The Boingo platform drives revenue through various products, including Wi-Fi, DAS (cellular), Media, Wholesale, and more.

We're an enthusiastic team, dedicated to growing our business by building amazing, valuable products. Boingo boasts a super-fun, collaborative work environment, with an annual pool tournament, Halloween costume contest, summer picnic, bowling nights, and more. There's a kitchen stocked with yummy snacks and drinks, and a well-appointed new mother's lounge. We offer an incredible benefits package, including unlimited vacation, parental leave, health, dental, vision, 401(k) match, equity, and more. And, our award-winning headquarters, located in Westwood, CA, has 360-degree views of LA, from Catalina to the Hollywood Sign. It's no wonder we've been named among the Best Places to Work in LA four years in a row, and counting!

Boingo is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Title: Manager, Data Analysis & Profiling
FullDescriptions:
Manager, Data Analysis & Profiling
Manger, Data Analysis and Profiling, Audience Analytics and Activation represents an exciting new role at Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE), positioned at the fast-moving intersection of film marketing strategy, digital ad tech, and big data / predictive modeling. The role is built for a self-starter, and creative, quantitative thinker; someone comfortable pushing for structured insights amidst disparate data sets, and excited about applying data and analytics to evolving Film Marketing.
At Sony Pictures, our mission is to map relevant movie and TV series content to consumers and audiences across transactional, subscription and linear viewing platforms. We’re building data products and visualization tools and insights platform that will predict audience preferences and behavior for library and new releases to drive growth of engagement and consumption of Sony produced content. Sony produces franchise brands such as Spiderman, Men in Black and Jumanji, through to TV franchises such as Breaking Bad, Blacklist and Better Call Saul. Our Data team is responsible for aggregating millions of consumer data points to best in class predictive models, consumer trends systems, recommendation engines and more!
In the role of Manager, Data Analysis and Profiling for The Sony Pictures Audience Analytics and Activation Division, you must a strong analytical and technical background and believe that data profiling, quality control, data integration across disparate data sets are foundational in enabling and driving a culture where data is democratized, accessible and easily interpreted for Sony Pictures to be a consumer-centric data driven organization.
You will work in the Data Management team that is responsible for the profiling, UAT, development and management of the Sony data licenses and cloud-based data platforms and sandboxes. You will be part of a team that is instrumental in partnering with Business Intelligence Team to enable data usage across the consumer analytics team, strategic business partners and business users.
You are a data optimization expert who is driven to ensure data quality, consistency, integration, connectivity across big data sets. You will work with our data science team, our business intelligence team, our strategic analysts and our diverse users in the business. You will provide a data management service spanning from data ingestion to end-user lifecycle: Profile, ingest, connect, features engineering, model, prepare, store and disseminate data.
You are data curious and business savvy with a strong background and demonstrated ability to navigate and analyze large and diverse data sets and be able to structure data so that it is meaningful and compelling.
Core Responsibilities include:
Work closely with consumer / audience analytics teams and technology partners as part of a complete data and analytics lifecycle.
Conduct data lifecycle activities: problem identification, hypothesis definition, data integration, data profiling, prototyping and experimentation, data schema design, development, testing and deployment
C onduct a broad range of analytics data management and optimization functions including development, scheduling, job optimization, version control management, data quality management, and issue resolution.
Develop and deliver attributes and deploying data preparation processes to be utilized for data warehouses/repositories/big data platforms, self-service reporting solutions, scorecards and dashboards on user-level audience and consumer data using analytical and visualization tools.
Work with teams to understand business requirements - translate and use complex data sources that needs to be blended, cleaned, structured and enriched into a desired output for analysis and utilized to deliver efficient and quality reports/ dashboards using various BI tools.
Partner with analysts to optimize and improve data operational processes.
Support User Acceptance Testing to ingest new data sets and migrate data sets to cloud platforms for data sandboxes.
Promote and evaluate use of software development best practices (including automated unit testing, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Dev Ops).
Execute version control, change management and continuous improvement protocols.
Collect and refine data from disparate data sources to support business requirements.
Partner with IT to schedule and optimize various ETL scripts.
Access and create various data sources to supplement existing data.
Troubleshoot and resolve data discrepancies, nuances and issues. P erform quality audits, identify data gaps / anomalies; conduct root cause analysis with recommended solutions, and track error resolution through completion.
Collaborate with strategic analysts and data scientists to use expanded data sets and query techniques.
Develop custom datasets and execute data extract queries to support ad hoc analyses and data science initiatives.
Create and implement datasets for to support management, analysis, dashboard reporting and advance analytics models needs.
Conduct ad hoc data mining and data profiling activities on new data .
Create documentation and logs for new and existing data sources including: drafting data dictionaries, providing data field definitions, developing common business data language, data nuances, data summaries and tracking aggregate tables and features engineering calculations.
Maintain data catalog with additions, changes and deletions to ensure most up-to-date information is available to other team members.
Present and communicate data summaries and presentations with the goal of data education
Preferred Qualifications:
Minimum 4+ years working as a Data Analyst, Data Profiler, Business Analyst for a medium to large scale BI implementation
Big Data concepts and common components including open source Spark (AWS) and in memory (RAM) analysis and multiple languages
Basic Java Script (useful if building APPS – but Python substitute to this)
Scala (relevant to streaming data)
Python, R
Data products – how to productionalize Data Science (“DS”) prototypes (build logic and components with scale)
Understanding of data engineering (data building blocks)
Advanced SQL, and/or Python scripting experience
Strong technology background: ETL and/or SQL coding experience: IBM Data Stage and Pentaho
Understanding of API – working and connecting with API (Software engineering)
Understand file constructs such Json, xml, flat files (CSV text files)
Understanding of .Net (C#, VB Script, Java script) OR Java application development
Experience in trouble shooting and resolving issues data systems
Experience designing high performing database queries / indexes and troubleshooting database performance issues
Knowledge of:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to deliver in a fast-paced and goals-based environment with time-bound deliverables
Skilled in collaboration, enjoys working with others and achieving results as a team
Passion and demonstrated experience in delivering results and meeting business goals in a matrix and cross functional environment
Strong Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse technical analysis skills, including ability to read and interpret data models and entity relationship diagrams, as well as to read, write, and analyze complex SQL statements and their output
2-3 years of hands-on experience with Teradata and Oracle database platforms and tools to analyze them (SQL Assistant, SQL Developer, etc.)
Prior experience working with centralized infrastructure teams for data architecture and database platform support
Strong proficiency with Microsoft data analysis tools such as Excel and Access
Strong experience in at least one of the following business disciplines: Retail Analytics, Consumer Analytics
Other:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Computer-related degree
2-3 years of experience with data warehousing and business intelligence
2-3 years of experience with all phases of a software development lifecycle

Title: Administrative Manager - School of Education
Skills:

Education:
Coordinates the administrative operations of the School of Education (SoE), providing the Dean with routine and special reports on budget, planning programs, and personnel. Directs Dean’s Office staff, coordinating assignments and workflow. Participates in their reviews; chairs regular office staff meetings.

APU is seeking employees who desire to engage in our thriving culture by cultivating community through professional interactions, demonstrating a posture of lifelong learning, and modeling Christ-like character. Working together, employees at APU commit to establishing a university atmosphere that is edifying to God and to one another.


Reports directly to the Dean and is responsible for directing administrative aspects of the School of Education, including oversight of budgets, records, reports, events, and personnel. Collaborates with the associate deans, chairs, and directors concerning the administration of the School’s programs and services; serves as Dean’s Office liaison to School faculty, staff, and students as well as University internal and external constituencies. Works to help develop vision and implement strategy for improved systems and operations. Supervises staff in Dean’s Office.

Monitors the development of reports to the Dean for internal review, as well as coordinating requests for information for the Provost and other constituents.

Demonstrates expert written and verbal communication skills, strong decision-making ability, and attention to detail.

Staff Development
Develop comprehensive SoE staff development process for onboarding new hires, enhancing retention through individualized development, and updating training as new systems (technology, recruiting, etc.) are implemented in SoE and/or the University.
Work with Dean to annually develop a survey to identify needs and preferences for staff training/development from both staff and their supervisors.

Leadership Team

Interface with members of the Leadership Team on behalf of the Dean, with judgment of time and content-sensitive transactions, ensuring prompt and confidential responses on behalf of the Dean's Office.
