Title: Strategic Analytics Manager
FullDescriptions:
Under the direction of the Director of Strategic Analytics, the Manager of Strategic Analytics serves as a leader in data curation, aggregation, management, analysis and visualization for enterprise-wide strategic initiatives and activities. The role will partner with other internal teams in the analysis and reporting of relevant proprietary data, and with external partners to increase access to data and analysis that support business decisions.

The Manager will develop, coach, mentor and lead a team of analysts that support AltaMed’s strategic initiatives, growth and performance. Additionally this position collaborates with other leaders in the Office for Strategy Execution and Analytics to define departmental goals and strategies, and support the implementation of projects and activities to achieve departmental goals in support of the enterprise strategic plan.
Responsibilities:
Lead development of local data mart, and data extraction, transformation and loading process to support business decisions and execution of enterprise strategies.
Monitor data quality by building classes, triggers and batch processes using SQL and coding languages such Java.
Builds partnerships with key data owners and data management teams, including DWH to access data, maintain data integrity and ensure source data and code accuracy.
Constructs complex data analysis queries and develops reports to provide key business solutions for senior management to translate analysis into actionable results.
Leads development of scorecards and dashboards to oversee and provide descriptive and/or predictive measures of product, service and personnel level performance and profitability.
Approaches development and analysis strategically, comfortable using agile methodologies to track iterative progress and ensure output is delivered on time and within budget.
Develop, mentor and coach a team of analysts to independently manage data, perform complex analysis, and produce reports for stakeholders and senior leadership.
Creates and presents summary level analysis and presentations to stakeholders, executive leadership and managers, internal and external partners data trends and perspectives for key strategic initiatives.
Reviews health policy, public health, business and other journals and periodicals to stay current and informed on issues that impact business, market and customer strategies.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in information systems, computer science, math, statistics or related field with appropriate professional and technical experience required. Master’s preferred.
2 years of hands on experience designing and developing dashboards and automated reports using data visualization tools, such as Tableau.
Minimum of 7 years hands on experience as a data scientist or data analyst, using data warehousing tools, ETL tools and data analysis technology to deploy complex cross-functional data analysis projects required.
Solid Experience in SQL, programming language such as VBA, Python or R with proven ability to create ETL jobs that extract from source systems, transform data based on business rules and requirements and load
Minimum of 2 years working in health data related field highly preferred.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The Black Tux is reinventing the formalwear rental industry so guys can show up at their best on the days that matter most. The company designs and manufactures modern rental suits and tuxedos that actually fit—made of 100% wool, ordered online or in one of our showrooms, and delivered for free. Using a combination of machine learning, tailor-trained fit specialists, and industry-leading customer service, The Black Tux guarantees a perfect fit every time.

As a Senior Data Analyst on the Data Science & Analytics team, your primary responsibility will be to work with stakeholders across business functions including growth, marketing, business development, finance and operations to build analytics products that enable data-driven decision making. You will guide analytics projects from discovery to solution and help us raise the bar for how we should apply our data to business decisions.
What You'll Do
Lead analysis projects with business stakeholders to monitor the health of the business and help the business make data-driven strategic and operational decisions
Define and analyze metrics across the business. Examples include conversion rates, customer lifetime value, and inventory life cycle data
Develop and own business intelligence dashboards to provide ongoing tracking and insights to business partners
Build and improve advanced analytical models, such as our fit algorithm and inventory forecasting
Collaborate with data engineering to improve data architecture and maintain a robust and accurate data warehouse
Discover ways to use analytics to support team members across the business to yield action through data-driven decision making
Who You Are
At least 3-5 years of related experience managing data analysis projects
Experience in eCommerce, retail, or a business with warehouse operations is a plus
Professional experience using advanced SQL in a cloud data warehouse environment (such as Redshift or Snowflake), including window functions and CTEs; Python or R experience is a plus
Strong data visualization and storytelling skills; Advanced Tableau experience is a plus
Working knowledge of business statistics and probability
Ability to build trust and communicate insights effectively with a variety of business stakeholders across analytical levels
Desire to be a partner to business stakeholders with a shared goal on using analytics and insights to drive the business forward
Given context, you're capable of self-direction and enthusiastic about owning your work
You deliver results quickly with iteration, instead of waiting for perfection
You are motivated to explore new technologies and can do so without taking formal education
You show modesty, kindness and support to your team and the people you work with

Benefits and Perks of Working at The Black Tux
Exciting startup environment
Weekly catered lunches
Dog-friendly office
Complimentary dry cleaning & tailoring services
Health, dental and vision coverage
401(k)
Paid parking
Parental leave (non-birthing parents included)
Open vacation time
Stocked kitchen & pantry
Apple equipment or whatever you need to be productive
Monthly team outings
Free suit and tuxedo rentals
We're an equal opportunity employer to all. We interview and hire applicants of all backgrounds, orientations, expressions, and identities.

Title: Business minded Data Analyst / BI Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Location: Los Angeles, California or Denver, Colorado

Founded in 2004 as the principal source of music for DJs, Beatport today is the worldwide home of electronic music for DJs, producers, and their fans. The Beatport Store offers music in premium digital formats and provides unique music discovery tools created for and by DJs. Each week, Beatport's music collection is refreshed with hundreds of exclusive tracks by the world's top electronic music artists. Beatport has offices in Denver, Los Angeles and Berlin.

About the Job:

As a BI Engineer at Beatport, you will be a member of the Business Intelligence team, part of the Business Operations department. You will be responsible for providing actionable insights and analytical support to our business, product, marketing and finance teams. You will handle data requests from Beatport stakeholders as well as ensure the quality of the underlying data. You will also coordinate with Beatport stakeholders to identify and develop reporting requirements.

Beatport operates a download store and a subscription service with its own data and business analysis needs and has ambitious plan to develop its platform. Our Data Analyst must be business minded and passionate about diving into and making sense of large, diverse datasets.

We are looking for someone who:

Has a minimum of four years experience in a data analytics or similar field

Has a Bachelor / Master degree in analytical discipline e.g. Maths, Physics, Computer Science or equivalent

Is eager to learn about various ways to analyze our business notably market analysis, user behavior, customer cohort and churn rate, product KPIs, A/B testing

Is proficient with SQL, enjoys scripting and working with data - ability to produce complex queries optimized for performance

Is detail oriented, care about the way data are presented: creating graphs, reports and presentations of analytical findings as well as creating clear and maintainable automated dashboards

Can develop insights and summarize data to all levels of management

Proficient in MS Excel / Google spreadsheets, web analytics tools like Google Analytics, data visualization tools (similar to Looker, Tableau)

Can find ways to gather data from various websites, APIs, spreadsheets, etc.

Can support Digital Marketing: customer journey analysis, marketing channel deep dive (performance)

Is a good communicator and enjoys working with teams

It would be great if you:

Have worked in a similar role for an entertainment / media / music company

Have a strong interest in the dance music and the music industry as a whole

Can work in at least one scripting language (Python, R, etc)

Have some Web development experience

Have some Project / Product management experience

Enjoy electronic dance music

To apply:

Please send a resume, and a short note introducing yourself and why this position appeals to you.

Title: AIA Data Analyst
Requirement:
Review the raw requirements to understand the key outcomes expected by the client.
Identify data source and conduct data profiling to understand data and its quality.
Create a logic that needs to be incorporated in the architecture to ensure the data meets the requirements.
Create POC to conduct the feasibility of the requirement, as required.
FullDescriptions:
Module lead(Depends on the project)

Qualification: Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent

Responsibility:Requirement Understanding and Analysis:

Review the raw requirements to understand the key outcomes expected by the client.
Identify data source and conduct data profiling to understand data and its quality.
Create a logic that needs to be incorporated in the architecture to ensure the data meets the requirements.
Create POC to conduct the feasibility of the requirement, as required.

Data Discovery & Profiling: • Post signoff, design basic queries to analyze the existing data.

Share sample data with the client to give a snapshot of the expected outcome.
Create a low level design document capturing SQL queries to achieve the target stage.
Share the document with the ETL team.
Conduct system integration testing during data migration from the source to the target state to ensure the requirements are met.
Conduct the root cause analysis of the issue to identify the solutions to resolve it.
Conduct testing to ensure the issue has been resolved.
In case of data issues, report it to the source team to fix the data.
If data is corrupted during migration, identify ways to cleanup the data.
Generate reports to fix the issues as required.
Understand the impact on data based on the release schedule.
Based on the understanding of the legacy system, provide inputs to the data modeler to map the attributes to the fields.
Share the data mapping documents with the data modeling team.
Support data modeling team to understand the data / data type in the legacy system.
Support data modeling team in defining table name and table data type as per the standards and best practices defined within the project.
In case of any new table in Data Warehouse, identify the source values to be uploaded in the table.
Provide inputs to data modeling regarding the source data for the same.

Knowledge Management: • Create and update knowledge articles (industry Point of View, Case studies, lessons learnt document etc) in the knowledge management repository.

Maintain knowledge management database.
Conduct training for team members on data profiling tools and techniques.

Sales Support: • Based on the inputs shared by the stakeholders.

share the inputs on RFPs on the data profiling and system analysis aspect.
Evaluate/ identify the tools best fit for the customer requirement.

Technical Skills SNo Primary Skill Proficiency Level * Rqrd./Dsrd. 1 Informatica PowerCenter PL1 Desired 2 ANSI SQL PL1 Required


Proficiency Legends Proficiency Level Generic Reference PL1 The associate has basic awareness and comprehension of the skill and is in the process of acquiring this skill through various channels. PL2 The associate possesses working knowledge of the skill, and can actively and independently apply this skill in engagements and projects. PL3 The associate has comprehensive, in-depth and specialized knowledge of the skill. She / he has extensively demonstrated successful application of the skill in engagements or projects. PL4 The associate can function as a subject matter expert for this skill. The associate is capable of analyzing, evaluating and synthesizing solutions using the skill.

Title: Member Experience Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The Member Experience Data Analyst analyzes member data from internal and external channels and generates actionable insights. Collaborates with the team members and stakeholders on developing strategies to improve member engagement and maintain high levels of member loyalty, satisfaction, and retention.


Partners with team members and stakeholders to obtain member insights data from various sources, such as surveys, online reviews, device usage data, and unsolicited feedback from members. • Leverages multiple data sources to develop root cause analysis of problem/opportunity: including but not limited to survey data, speech and text analytics platform, and qualitative insights from both internal and external customers.
Reviews monthly relationship and touchpoint survey reports. Analyzes survey results and other free form data to identify trends, statistics, and issues.
Analyzes member survey data to identify points of friction in the member journey.
Conducts Voice of the Customer analyses and identifies positive and negative member satisfaction patterns. Uses structured data to create statistical reports, highlighting trends and patterns.
Assists with creates, defines and tracks key metrics to measure the success of efforts to improve the experience of all members.
Recommends success measures that help tie member experience improvements to business performance and opportunities to improve metrics related to operational costs, member satisfaction and employee satisfaction.
Works with team members and stakeholders to create actionable resolution plans for issues that negatively impact the member experience.
Reviews monthly data reports and other outside reports to understand product usage trends and overall member behavior, introducing actionable human insights that inform the member experience.
Identifies positive and negative customer satisfaction patterns. Uses structured data to create statistical reports, highlighting trends and patterns.
Perform the analytical due diligence required to understand the impact of department initiatives on other areas of the business.
Implements mechanisms to report, analyze, and measure progress of changes to member experience. Reviews outcomes to determine if additional modifications are required.

QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Ability):


Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in statistics, data analysis, data mining, information management or related disciplines with four years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Demonstrated strong proficiency with tools and applications commonly used in data analysis such as SAS, SPSS, Excel pivot tables/macros, and Tableau. Ability to analyze and synthesize data, and trends.
Uses excellent presentation and communications skills to present complex ideas and recommendations in a clear and articulate manner to all levels of the organization.
Advanced knowledge of internet software for research purposes and Office Suite of Products.
Ability to multi-task and perform effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Process-flow modeling a plus.
Financial institution experience a plus.

Must also demonstrate conduct consistent with our Corporate Values:


Practice open Communication with all levels;
Be Accountable by taking ownership of customer issues and responsibility for one's actions;
Foster Teamwork by cooperating and collaborating with other employees;
Seek ways to make the workplace Fun for oneself & others;
Conduct oneself with Integrity by being honest, trustworthy and ethical in all work activities and interactions;
Work with a Service Orientation by having a genuine concern for the needs of one's customers and by being friendly, professional and following through on commitments; and
Demonstrate Humility in all interactions and remember to leave one's ego at the door when one arrives to work.

Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
5 years of experience with data analytics/statistical tools and techniques
Analyze and manage large, complex data sets from multiple source systems
Develop and conduct user acceptance testing, and collaborate with IT during implementation of system enhancements
Identify and resolve source data system changes that may affect reporting accuracy
Conduct impact and risk assessments, and develop risk mitigation plans
Government agency reporting, automotive industry, and manufacturing systems experience is preferred
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including use of pivot tables, functions, formulas, and charts
Proficient with SQL using database management software (e.g. IBM Data Studio or similar)

Demonstrated leadership and collaboration with application programmers and database/system architects

Detail oriented with strong organizational, written, and verbal communication skills
Responsibilities:
Execute and validate quarterly NHTSA Early Warning reports (aggregate data) to ensure TREAD Act compliance
Work with ISD to resolve complex data issues and support the implementation of production fixes and system enhancements to prevent issue reoccurrence

FullDescriptions:
The Sr. Data Analyst is responsible for advanced data analysis, validation, and issue resolution in order to generate reports that meet the requirements of the Transportation Recall Enhancement, Accountability and Documentation (TREAD) Act mandated by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).

Responsibilities:
Execute and validate quarterly NHTSA Early Warning reports (aggregate data) to ensure TREAD Act compliance
Work with ISD to resolve complex data issues and support the implementation of production fixes and system enhancements to prevent issue reoccurrence
Conduct data and trend analysis to identify system/data issues and lead continuous improvements with business groups to apply countermeasures and ensure reporting accuracy

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
5 years of experience with data analytics/statistical tools and techniques
Analyze and manage large, complex data sets from multiple source systems
Develop and conduct user acceptance testing, and collaborate with IT during implementation of system enhancements
Identify and resolve source data system changes that may affect reporting accuracy
Conduct impact and risk assessments, and develop risk mitigation plans
Government agency reporting, automotive industry, and manufacturing systems experience is preferred
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including use of pivot tables, functions, formulas, and charts
Proficient with SQL using database management software (e.g. IBM Data Studio or similar)
Knowledge of business intelligence applications such as SAP Business Objects, Tableau, and SAS
Proven ability to prioritize tasks in a fast paced, deadline-driven environment
Skilled at developing, communicating, and documenting business requirements, including using process flowcharts
Demonstrated leadership and collaboration with application programmers and database/system architects
Ability to frequently resolve problems independently or as member of a multifunctional team
Detail oriented with strong organizational, written, and verbal communication skills

Title: Clinical Assurance Data Analyst III (Temporary with Benefits)
FullDescriptions:
Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in five health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.

Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.

Job Summary

The Clinical Assurance Data Analyst III supports quality and process improvement activities by producing healthcare outcome measurements that are used for internal and external reporting, the tasks including data warehouse building, data quality assurance, process programming, specification documentation and report developing.

The Clinical Assurance Data Analyst III applies technical skills to design, develop, and generate ad hoc or production reports that may evolve into complex data analysis/data integration projects that this individual may be responsible for maintaining. The complex data analysis/integration projects are those which may require periodic maintenance on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, biannual, or annual basis. This position works with Information Systems analysts when ongoing reports can be accurately transferred for production.

This position interprets and documents both written and verbal specifications. This position takes basic instructions or specifications and interviews the client for complete details sufficient for writing data queries based for ad hoc and ongoing health care measures. This position must comprehend the relationships between the field elements in encounters and claims, membership, and provider databases.
This Clinical Assurance Data Analyst III is a key resource to the HOA department on application use. This position supports the functions related to quality improvement activities inclusive of quarterly reports that demonstrate health care outcomes in comparison to targets or national averages/percentiles published by recognized organizations such as NCQA and CDC. Analytic skills include the ability to identify data aberrations and recognize data patterns that impact quality.


Duties
Develop automatic, robust and sharable SAS procedures and programs towards building a comprehensive clinical data repository. Design, develop, and generate ad hoc/production reports.

Creates work tools that facilitate tasks by reducing paperwork and errors. Document assumptions, specification in a clear and sharable fashion.

Produce accurate analysis as allowed by resources. Identifies and creates work-around to create valid results that meet the intent of the client's specifications. Produces periodic results as scheduled.

Share findings and trends with clinical and operations staff, provider network and other stakeholders. Be able to present findings of data analyses at internal and external meetings, professional conferences and stakeholder meetings. These reports can be in the form of PowerPoint presentation, discussions during meetings or in as a formal written report.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Education Required
Bachelor's Degree in Statistics or Related Field
In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered.
Education Preferred
Master's Degree in Statistics or Related Field
Experience
Required:
A minimum of 5 years of experience in designing, developing, and generating ad hoc/production reports.

Working knowledge of MS Access, Excel, and Word software.

Preferred:
Work experience in the health care field of at least two years.

Past work with membership, provider, and claims encounter/claims.

Previous experience with report generation using health care data with focus on elements from encounter/claims, membership, and provider data.

Working knowledge of SAS PROC SQL, SAS MACRO, SAS IML, SAS STAT a plus.

Skills
Required:
Medium to Advanced SAS programming skills.

Demonstrated ability to use relational databases for the purpose of generating ad hoc reports.

The ability to work well in a team setting with individuals having professional backgrounds in the technical and/or clinical fields.

Must demonstrate the ability to work independently and seek solutions proactively.

Able to apply critical thinking in evaluating priorities/solutions.

Preferred:
Demonstrated ability to take responsibility for making sure requested projects meet the client's needs with respect to data accuracy, format, and timeliness.

Licenses/Certifications Required
Licenses/Certifications Preferred
Statistical Analysis System (SAS) Certification
Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA)
Required Training
Additional Information
L.A. Care offers a wide range of benefits including
Medical, Dental and Vision
Wellness Program
Paid Sick Leave

FullDescriptions:
Introduction
For more than 40 years, East West Bank has served as a pathway to success. With over 130 locations across the U.S. and Greater China, we are the premier financial bridge between the East and West. Our teams of experienced, multi - cultural professionals help guide businesses and community members on both sides of the Pacific looking to explore new markets and create new opportunities, and our sustained growth and expertise in industries like real estate, entertainment and media, private equity and venture capital, high-tech and aviation help build sustainable businesses and expand our employees' potential for career advancement.

Headquartered in California, East West Bank (Nasdaq: EWBC) is a top performing commercial bank with an exclusive focus on the U.S. and Greater China markets. With assets of $41 billion, we've ranked among the 30 largest banks in the United States. And since 2010, we have been recognized by Forbes as one of the top 15 best banks in America. With a strong foundation, and enterprising spirit and a commitment to absolute integrity, East West Bank gives people the confidence to reach further.
Overview
East West Bank is seeking a Data Analyst. The Data Analyst works with banking data and business units to propose, design, and deliver business solutions. The data analyst will collect and analyze data wherever it resides, including in spreadsheets, files, databases, and APIs. The data analyst will create reports, dashboards, and other visualizations and they will develop applications that collect data from users to enrich enterprise data sets to improve their completeness and accuracy.

Title: Data Intelligence Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Meet REVOLVE:
REVOLVE is the next-generation fashion retailer for Millennial and Generation Z consumers. As a trusted, premium lifestyle brand, and a go-to online source for discovery and inspiration, we deliver an engaging customer experience from a vast yet curated offering totaling over 45,000 apparel, footwear, accessories and beauty styles. Our dynamic platform connects a deeply engaged community of millions of consumers, thousands of global fashion influencers, and more than 500 emerging, established and owned brands. Through 16 years of continued investment in technology, data analytics, and innovative marketing and merchandising strategies, we have built a powerful platform and brand that we believe is connecting with the next generation of consumers and is redefining fashion retail for the 21st century. For more information please visitwww.revolve.com.
At REVOLVE the most successful team members have a thirst and the creativity to make this the top e-commerce brand in the world. With a team of 1,000+ based out of Cerritos, California we are a dynamic bunch that are motivated by getting the company to the next level. It’s our goal to hire high-energy, diverse, bright, creative, and flexible individuals who thrive in a fast-paced work environment. In return, we promise to keep REVOLVE a company where inspired people will always thrive.
Some of the sweetest perks we offer aren’t in a typical benefit package like hefty discount on items we carry – as in 50% or more off retail prices, free weekly lunches, and pretty rad company parties.
To take a behind the scenes look at the REVOLVE “corporate” lifestyle check out our Instagram @REVOLVEcareers or #lifeatrevolve.
Main purpose of the position:
The Data Intelligence Analyst plays a critical role in actively building, upgrading, and maintaining the data-centric nucleus of the Buying and Merchandising arm of REVOLVE headquarters. This position partners with a multitude of end-users ranging the spectrum all the way from Buyers up to Executives in order to keep us on the cutting edge of Fashion Retail by developing world class proprietary tools and internal processes.
The Data Intelligence Analyst’s primary objective is to support the Buying and Planning arm of the company in order to ensure that shrewd inventory purchasing and manufacturing decisions are consistently being made day-in and day-out so as to keep fueling our aggressive top-line growth trajectory while continuing to push the limits of our bottom-line profitability. We are a data-driven, metrics-oriented culture and lean heavily on our Data Intelligence team to be the first line of defense in ensuring that we continue driving the business forward and maximizing opportunities, all while minimizing risk by leveraging deep data analytics.
The ideal candidate for the Data Intelligence Analyst position should measure high on the scale for intellectual curiosity, ingenuity, and results. Our analysts pride themselves on being out of the box thinkers who can collaborate well with a diverse range of input, feedback, and experience to consistently raise the bar and deliver results well above and beyond expectations. We are looking for candidates who are eager to make an impact and willing to go that extra mile. It is in our team’s DNA to work hard and play harder.
Position responsibilities and daily tasks:
Build, Extract, and Data Mine a variety of large data sets to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities in order to produce predictive insights and action items to move the business forward
Design and Execute experiments to produce proof of concept in order to help prioritize resource investments, recommend next steps, etc
Examine business practices and Develop predictive tools and reporting to support inventory purchasing, design, and manufacturing decision-making
Design and Implement normalized data models
Develop, Test, and Implement new business metrics
Continually Improve existing processes with automation, new technology, key insights, best practices
Collaborate with analysts, data engineers, project managers, and subject matter experts to deliver impactful solutions and processes for new organizational initiatives
Multi-task a steady flow of incoming and concurrent projects and priorities ranging from high- visibility executive needs to adhoc requests from internal customers
Engage with business leaders, end users, and team members to develop deep understanding of the business and its needs
What does a candidate need to demonstrate to perform this job successfully:
Advanced math skills, with deep knowledge and understanding of numerical and statistical methods
Advanced understanding of relational database concepts
Expertise in SQL while being comfortable in an additional data programming language (such as Python)
Advanced skills with stored procedures, functions, expressions, views
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel, VBA and Userform development
Data-mining skill, and expertise in visualizing and manipulating big datasets
Aptitude for understanding business environment and translating business requirements to technical solutions
Strong problem-solving skills to propose multiple solutions, properly weigh tradeoffs and ROI, identify the best path forward, and exercise good judgment to drive ahead
Comfort interacting and collaborating with people across all levels of the organization while fielding questions as a true Subject Matter Expert
Ability to articulate thoughts and findings both orally and in writing
Agile development mindset, understanding and appreciating the benefit of constant iteration and improvement
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and to keep abreast of current and future technology and trends
Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities, and meet deadlines
Strong attention to detail
Minimum candidate qualifications (years of experience, education level, technical skills, software, etc):
A minimum of 2 to 5 years of quantitative analytical experience with a proven track record of achieving successful results from data-mining large databases
Advanced experience with designing and building spreadsheet models
SQL and PL/SQL
Excel
Bachelor's or Master's degree required

Title: Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst
Contribution Management MARST01203
Apply now

Posted: July 30, 2019
Full-Time
Burbank, CA, USA
Job Details
Description
The overall objective of an Master Data Management (MDM) Analyst is data quality, in regard to the key data elements existing within the MDM. This essential position ensures that data coming in from various sources is in harmony and will be able to be used by the Contribution Management System for efficient and automated data processing. This position will be responsible for maintaining four data domains (People, Company, Project & Contract) within the MDM. The MDM Analyst identifies and resolves issues with MDM data including duplicate data, creation of new data, etc.

Essential job functions

Following policies and procedures will review and complete system generated tasks aimed to resolve issues with MDM data (i.e. mismatched data, typos, missing fields, etc.)
Determine where the data should reside within the MDM System. This requires the ability to differentiate between the four data domains (People, Company, Project & Contract) and maintain knowledge of internal business processes. I.E. People Data= Brad Pitt, Company Data= Warner Brothers
Provide insight to Business Analyst on opportunities for improvements in matching and automation.
Review and collaborate with Business Analyst to identify and resolve systematic MDM issues.
Ensure compliance with procedures for data integrity, continuous cash flow and exceptional participant service in relation to HIPAA and confidentiality protocol.
Identifies when tasks within the MDM system need to be escalated and follows escalation procedures.
Knowledge, skills, and abilities

Knowledge of processing in a database environment.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).
Knowledge of various file types (Excel, CSV, XML, TXT).
Ability to understand and apply knowledge of Collective Bargaining Agreements
Ability to work under pressure in a demanding, fast-paced environment and to work under tight time constraints and meet deadlines.
Ability to understand or quickly learn Taft-Hartley multi-employer pension and health plans.
Ability to ascertain when information is missing or incorrect for the purpose of maintaining data integrity
Ability to differentiate between the four data domains and maintain knowledge of internal business processes.
High attention to detail
Competencies

Customer focus - Gains insight into customer needs; identifies opportunities that benefit the customer; builds and delivers solutions that meet customer expectations; establishes and maintains effective customer relationships.
Decision quality – Makes sound decisions, even in the absence of complete information; relies on a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment when making decisions; considers all relevant factors and uses appropriate decision-making criteria and principles; recognizes when a quick 80% solution will suffice.
Communicates effectively – Is effective in a variety of communication settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels; attentively listens to others; adjusts to fit the audience and the message; provides timely and helpful information to others across the organization; encourages the open expression of diverse ideas and opinions.
Ensures accountability – follows through on commitments and makes sure others do the same; acts with a clear sense of ownership; takes personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and failures; establishes clear responsibilities and processes for monitoring work and measuring results; designs feedback loops into work.
Instills trust – follows through on commitments; is seen as direct and truthful; keeps confidences; practices what he/she preaches; shows consistency between words and actions.
Manages complexities – Asks the right questions to accurately analyze situations; acquires data from multiple and diverse sources when solving problems; uncovers root causes to difficult problems; evaluates pros and cons, risks and benefits of different solution options.
Drives results – Has a strong bottom-line orientation; persists in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks; has a track record of exceeding goals successfully; pushes self and helps others achieve results.
Collaborates – Works cooperatively with others across the organization to achieve shared objectives; represents own interests while being fair to others and their areas; partners with others to get work done; credits others for their contributions and accomplishments; gains trust and support of others.

Qualifications
Behaviors
Preferred
Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
Motivations
Preferred
Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
Education
Required
High School or better.
Preferred
Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field.
Experience
Required
1 year: Experience reviewing and completing system generated workflows in a high production environment.
1 year: Experience with data management in an enterprise system
Preferred
Entertainment industry knowledge
Combination of High School Diploma or GED Certificate with relevant work experience

Title: Business Analyst
FullDescriptions:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Business Analyst is position responsible for identifying data needs and metrics and ensuring the integrity of all data used to support departmental reporting needs.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Effectively translate customer reporting requirements into design documents; conduct report consolidation and validation; use statistical methods to analyze data and generate a useful business report.
Communicate effectively with internal teams and external customers to deliver functional requirements.
Act as a primary liaison between the external sales team and the internal team to ensure the solution aligns to project scope and that it will ultimately meet user needs.
Work with departmental managers to outline the specific data needs for each business method analysis project.
Responsible to verify data accuracy and maintain records or files in accordance with standard procedures and methods; may also assist the team in various projects as needed.
Develop new metrics to assess operational performance. Create, maintain, optimize and support new and existing reports.


ESSENTIAL CORE COMPETENCIES

Strong Excel spreadsheet skills with either professional or academic experience in order to sort, track, compile and report-on large amounts of data effectively
2+ years’ Data mining experience
4+ years in a data analyst role
Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
Strong attention to detail
Advanced decision making and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. Preferably bilingual in Chinese


EDUCATION

Bachelor Degree (Business with accounting emphasis)

Title: Business Analyst, Digital Marketing
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or technical discipline preferred
At least 3 - 5 years of data analyst experience with an emphasis in digital marketing
Analytics software experience with Google Analytics, Optimizely, Tableau, SQL
Advanced in MS-Excel (vlookup, pivot table, sumif, filter, index match etc.)
An understanding of digital marketing KPIs on Adwords and Facebook in particular
Ability to develop and contribute to process and systems improvements, adaptable to working in a fast paced startup atmosphere and a cloud-based environment
Ability to multi-task and work efficiently
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with marketing and product team in providing analysis that supports their ongoing efforts which include: paid digital marketing campaign optimization, recurring reporting (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) and A/B testing
Design, develop, and launch new Excel reports and dashboards according to stakeholder requirements
Support ad hoc requests for data analysis from external stakeholders in finance, strategy and product.
Draw out key business insights and provide actionable recommendations.
FullDescriptions:
Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company providing internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to successful real estate teams across the country. With over 1,000 real estate teams on our platforms, we’re generating 1MM+ leads annually. Ylopo is looking for a business analyst who will be joining a small, but growing marketing and product team. This person will own a variety of tasks related to marketing and product functions such as data analysis and reporting, dashboard creation, supporting weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports, and analytics support for any new business initiatives. A successful candidate will be inquisitive and comfortable with ambiguity, have strong data analysis skills, superior Excel skills, and SQL knowledge. We are seeking a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment who is not afraid to get their hands dirty in building and improving reporting at a fast growing startup.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with marketing and product team in providing analysis that supports their ongoing efforts which include: paid digital marketing campaign optimization, recurring reporting (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) and A/B testing
Design, develop, and launch new Excel reports and dashboards according to stakeholder requirements
Support ad hoc requests for data analysis from external stakeholders in finance, strategy and product.
Draw out key business insights and provide actionable recommendations.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or technical discipline preferred
At least 3 - 5 years of data analyst experience with an emphasis in digital marketing
Analytics software experience with Google Analytics, Optimizely, Tableau, SQL
Advanced in MS-Excel (vlookup, pivot table, sumif, filter, index match etc.)
An understanding of digital marketing KPIs on Adwords and Facebook in particular
Ability to develop and contribute to process and systems improvements, adaptable to working in a fast paced startup atmosphere and a cloud-based environment
Ability to multi-task and work efficiently

About Ylopo:

We are the U.S leaders in Real Estate digital marketing on Facebook using Dynamic Ads for Real Estate, big data, catalogs and API’s to run campaigns at scale for real estate clients all over the U.S. Facebook themselves have done 3 case studies on us and working on a 4th.


Ylopo’s rapid growth means that the work is fast-paced and there’s never a dull moment, while Ylopo’s relatively small size means we highly value each individual team member and care deeply about their personal development and happiness at the company.

Overview:
The Analyst will work as part of our Care Management and Compliance team that is responsible for coordinating care for thousands of patients in Southern CA.
Leadership and the team across each region will look to you for key input on operational decisions that will drive performance improvement across quality of patient care, cost efficiencies, and productivity. This high visibility role will engage with senior leadership across our Southern California market. A successful, developed candidate in this role should expect future, promotional opportunities within the organization.
Project examples:
Creating the framework and process to analyze the performance (volume and quality) of our core programs and helping to drive associated improvement plans

Title: Principal Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Become a key contributor to a world-renowned health care leader. Advance exceptional patient care through innovative technology solutions. Take your career in a rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, UCan do all this and more.


In this vital role, you will provide advanced quality data and analytical support, including the development and management of databases that improve workflow efficiency. You will help drive data-intensive quality improvement projects for such areas as general surgery, urology, orthopedics, and neurology. This involves preparing reports and Tableau dashboards, and presenting your findings to department leaders and teams. We’re looking to you to identify critical issues and develop solutions using PDCA and Lean methodologies.

We’re seeking an outstanding team member with:

BS in computer science, mathematics, statistics, business, quantitative analysis or related field (Master’s preferred)
Three years of data management/analysis experience desired, ideally with a background in health care and Tableau development
Proficiency with Tableau, SQL/Pytho/R, Excel, PowerPoint
Demonstrated expertise in clinical data analytics, statistics, and quality measures
Exceptional analytical and quantitative analytical skills
Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, organizational, communication and project management abilities
Knowledge of current health care industry issues and regulatory requirements
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment


UCLA Health is a world-renowned health system with four award-winning hospitals and dozens of primary care practices, specialty practices, urgent care centers and other ancillary locations throughout metro Los Angeles. Through the efforts of our outstanding people, we have become Los Angeles’ trusted provider of exceptional, compassionate patient care. If you’re looking to experience greater challenge and fulfillment in your career, UCan at UCLA Health.

FullDescriptions:
GENERAL SUMMARY:

We are hiring for a Senior Data Analyst on the Medi-Cal Encounter Analytics team within the Actuarial Department. This position will conduct in-depth analysis to ensure the quality of claims/encounter data submitted to regulatory entities. This position will need to work closely with multiple departments, be able to rapidly understand and navigate new situations, and be able to create solutions on the go.


In order to create an effective team, nearly every single individual on the team needs to be extraordinarily strong in their technical background with the ability to learn quickly. The analyst will be part of a team that is leading and developing new programs and new processes.
In addition to strong technical skills, this position will require the soft communication skills to be able to articulate complex concepts to individuals lacking in a technical background.

This position may provide support towards eventual attainment of the Associate or Fellow, Society of Actuaries (SOA) designation, if desired.


Qualifications

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ensure complete and accurate submission of supplemental data to regulatory entities.
Maintain tracking reports for claims/encounter data quality.
Create new reports based on input from manager and other stakeholders.
Improve existing processes for efficiency.
Analysis into Medi-Cal risk adjustment.
Work with cross-functional teams to meet objectives.
Special projects as requested.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:

Requires minimum of a bachelors’ degree in a technical or quantitative field (GPA: 3.0+) or equivalent combination of experience and education.
At least 5 years of healthcare experience, with at least 2 years in a data analysis role.

Technical Skills:
Strong programming experience including SQL or SAS knowledge
Proficient with MS Office (Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint)

Personal/Leadership Skills:
Excellent communication skills (oral, written, and presentation).
Strong interpersonal skills. Able to collaborate with other cross-functional areas to meet objectives.
Independent problem-solver. Proactive. Able to multi-task.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Experience:
Medi-Cal or Medicare experience.
Healthcare claims knowledge.

Office Environment - roles involving part to full time schedule in Office Environment. Based in our physical offices and work from home office/deskwork – Activity level: Sedentary, frequency most of work day.

Title: RISK ADJUSTMENT DATA ANALYST - DM
FullDescriptions:
SUMMARY
The RA (Risk Adjustment Data Analyst) is responsible for providing and maintaining the Risk Adjustment reporting, monitoring program performance to the organizations including key performance indicators, identifying and recommending areas of reporting improvement, and developing and communicating clear action plans to drive processes both internally and externally. The duties and responsibilities will apply to all IPAs managed by Network Medical Management.
The RA Data Analyst will also be assisting in special projects requested by NMM executives including but not limited to ACO activities.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze data from IPA network providers and Sub-IPA Groups relating to Risk Adjustment.
Maintain current reporting packages for internal and external clients as well as develop new reports of moderate complexity
Create core reporting dashboards summarizing and trending all aspects of Medicare business, CMS Revenue, Enrollment and Risk Adjustment
Provide and reconcile data and analysis for HCC gaps – health plan and internal data.
Perform data mining of claims, encounters and RAPS/EDS data to identify trends, data issues and members with missing hierarchical condition categories (HCC’s)
Perform audits on submitted claims and encounter data to verify CMS regulatory compliance
Perform cyclical RAPS data submission reconciliation to ensure maximum data throughout. Compare RAPS submission to claims and encounter data, identify claims and encounters that have not been submitted to CMS
Execute standard processes / programs to ensure accurate and timely data is provided to internal and external clients
Recommend and implement new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve business processes, report content and completeness of information
Serve as the liaison between departments, markets and data management for all Risk Adjustment reporting needs
Troubleshoot all errors, data inconsistencies and coordinate resolutions to issues as directed
Assist in ACO projects, activities, and reporting as requested.
Understand the principles of HIPAA and maintain confidentiality of patient health information.
Understand the principles of Risk Adjustment based CMS standards.
Communicate internally and externally as needed to gather necessary data.
Promote a positive working relationship between NMM, IPA’s, and health plan.
Attend IPA and health plan meetings as required and respond to questions/inquiries in a timely manner.
Attend meetings as needed to review reports and deliverables on an as needed basis.
Understand how to communicate difficult and sensitive information tactfully. Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify any potential crisis or issues and devise contingency plans to mitigate concerns
Responsible for documenting and updating changes to workflow, training plans, policies and procedures, as directed
Performs all other related duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors’ degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Data Science or 2 + years of decision support, data analysis, or healthcare operations experience
2+ years of health care or risk adjustment experience
Possession of strong analytical/statistical skills used in evaluating and analyzing data
Advance PC skills (PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Advance Excel skills (pivot tables, reporting, charts)
Intermediate SQL skills, experience using Power BI and EzCap
Must value operating in a collaborative and cooperative environment, ability to show initiative good judgement and resourcefulness
Excellent organizational, decision-making and multi-tasking skills
Proven ability to prioritized and organize multi-faceted/multiple responsibilities simultaneously in a fast paced, changing environment while meeting deadlines and turnaround time requirements
Must be able to work independently utilizing all resources available while staying within the boundaries of duties
Ability to keep a high level of confidence and discretion when dealing with sensitive matters relating to providers, members, business plans, strategies and other sensitive information is required
PERSONAL & PROFESSIONAL QUALITIES
Punctuality, Creativity, Self-motivation
Professional appearance and conduct
Conceptual and “big picture” understanding
Able to function independently under time constraints
Willing to learn and develop new responsibilities and skills
Good organization, critical thinking and problem solving skills
Must be detail-oriented and able to work autonomously but also as a team member
Strong communication and customer service skills and respect for confidentiality
STATUS
Non-Exempt

Title: Operations Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Greenlots is unlocking the possibilities of the new electric mobility future by delivering innovative software and services that empowers utilities, cities, communities and automakers to deploy EV charging infrastructure at scale. Our technology is connecting people to their destinations in a safer, cleaner, and smarter way. Headquartered in Los Angeles, CA, the company’s global footprint spans across three continents with deployments in 13 different countries.

We are looking for an Operations Data Analyst. In this position, you will support our Operations Hardware Procurement and Customer Experience teams, building reports pulling data from various systems such as Freshdesk, Smartsheet, Zoho, SKY, NetSuite. You will also support development and implementation of new systems and procedures. You will be part of a great team that is going through some really exciting growth and development.

What You’ll Do:

Support the Hardware Procurement team: develop hardware scorecard
Support the Customer Experience team: develop customer health scorecard
Implement new systems, populate the data and play an integral role in maintaining data integrity
Develop training materials and develop team members
Seek for information from cross functional team members
Design and generate new reports to support cross functional teams
Present reports and suggest improvement plans
What We’re Looking For:

Bachelor degree in engineering required
5+ years in a data analyst role
1+ year of experience in the EV industry
Fast pace learner and self-starter
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills, collaborative skills, and cross-functional interface skills
Comfortable with change
Organized
Ability to prioritize
Attention to detail
Advanced with Microsoft Office
PMI certification is a plus
What We Offer:

Benefits: Full health-care coverage for employees (medical, dental, vision), 401K, annual discretionary bonus, generous holiday calendar.
Daily ownership of your role in a challenging, high-growth environment
Environment: You’ll get to work with and learn from some of the best and brightest in this emerging market.

Title: Data Analyst, SQL
Education: BA/BS in Business, Economics, Finance, Data Science, Computer Science or related field
FullDescriptions:
About Herbalife Nutrition

Herbalife Nutrition is a global nutrition company whose purpose is to make the world healthier and happier. We have been on a mission for nutrition - changing people's lives with great nutrition products & programs - since 1980. Together with our Herbalife Nutrition independent distributors, we are committed to providing solutions to the worldwide problems of poor nutrition and obesity, an aging population, skyrocketing public healthcare costs and a rise in entrepreneurs of all ages. Herbalife Nutrition offers high-quality, science-backed products, most of which are produced in Company-operated facilities, one-on-one coaching with an Herbalife Nutrition independent distributor, and a supportive community approach that inspires customers to embrace a healthier, more active lifestyle.

Herbalife Nutrition’s targeted nutrition, weight-management, energy and fitness and personal care products are available exclusively to and through dedicated distributors in more than 90 countries.
Through our corporate social responsibility efforts, Herbalife Nutrition supports the Herbalife Nutrition Foundation (HNF) and its Casa Herbalife programs to help bring good nutrition to children in need. Herbalife Nutrition is also proud to sponsor more than 190 world-class athletes, teams and events around the globe, including Cristiano Ronaldo, the LA Galaxy, and numerous Olympic teams.
Herbalife has over 8,000 employees worldwide, and our shares are traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: HLF) with net sales of approximately $4.4 billion in 2017. To learn more, visit Herbalife.com or IAmHerbalife.com.

POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT:
The Data Analyst will be responsible for data mining and integrating data from various sources, ensuring data consistency, create analysis-ready data sets (SQL, R), conducting analysis and providing appropriate output to support the business through data analytics. The Data Analyst will focus on specific high priority projects that will support different internal business stakeholders (including Senior Executives, Legal Department and Operations). The responsibilities will include writing complex SQL queries, developing and maintaining Store Procedures for company Key Metrics, employing various modeling (e.g. attribution, predictive, regression, etc.) and data visualization techniques on a regular and ad-hoc basis.

DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance.
Develop logic, build from scratch and maintain Member analytical reports (both ad-hoc and scheduled) using SQL, Excel, BI/Micro Strategy and/or Access programs.
Develop SQL code to automate and improve efficiencies, quality and timeliness of current routine reports and processes.
Write and run complex queries using SQL to validate data and investigate discrepancies, build/augment reporting functionality, develop systematic processes to routinely maintain and update data.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources.
Extract data to manipulate/calculate/format into presentable reports, charts, and graphs for PowerPoint presentations.
Support monthly and quarterly Key Metrics and trends validation process to ensure accuracy. The validation process includes ensuring that data is accurately captured from various data sources, understanding and interpretation of data formulas, and calculations and troubleshooting of variances.
Collaborates with IS and Business Intelligence team, in ongoing decisions regarding data collection, validation, methodology and integration of new functionalities.
Participate in the projects supporting company strategic initiatives
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Skills:
Knowledge and experience with different types of databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, Netezza, and Database design structure
Proficient knowledge of pivot tables, macros, editing VBA/SQL, v-lookup, queries, and report writing to analyze data and consolidate reports
Experience in data visualization techniques to provide statistical insight of performance of the monitored process.
Self-starter, intellectually curious and has a strong attention to detail who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.
Strong analytical skills to evaluate, understand and interpret data from both internal and external perspective
Must be able to communicate ideas and analysis results effectively both verbally and in writing to both analytical and non-analytical audience
Assists with the production of weekly, monthly, year-to-date and year-end reporting, including variance and trend analysis of results to budget, prior year and forecast.
Must demonstrate an ability to recognize and define problems, understand business and system processes, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Must be able to formulate and communicate questions to gather the necessary missing information to resolve a problem.
Self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Goal oriented, multi-task projects, superior time management and organizational skills
Able and willing to work in the fast pace environment with demanding deadlines
Experience:
3+ years of experience in the functional areas of business analysis, financial analysis, statistical model development, business administration/analysis, or related field.
1-2 years of complex data analytics, writing queries and coding experience in SQL (ideal backgrounds include: a similar business analyst role at a web company, a data-based consulting role, or other data strategy type positions).
Knowledge of Relational Models and Data Warehouse methodology and isolate and resolve issues with data and databases.
Experience with Business Intelligence applications such as MicroStrategy, Cognos, Tableau.

Education:
BA/BS in Business, Economics, Finance, Data Science, Computer Science or related field
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Expert knowledge of Herbalife Marketing Plan and business model
Experience employing data-oriented programming languages (Python or R preferred) for analysis
Proficiency in Adobe and Google Analytics
Proficiency with T-SQL and the SQL Server Platform

Title: Data Analyst - SAS/SQL
Skills:
Translates business and technical needs, issues, and ideas into effective strategies and action plans.
Elicits detailed business requirements and builds effective, data driven and analytical solutions to meet requirements (requires SQL, SAS, and integration from data from multiple db/file formats)
Formulates specific implementation plans and evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented.

Participates in the development of process improvements and related outcomes
Works closely with business, IT, and non-Clients partners
Very strong analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team.
Experience with provider demographic data.

Contract to Hire Position - Only considering candidates who can convert to FTE.
NO SPONSORSHIP

SUMMARY
This position is responsible for supporting improvements and systems solutions for Client's provider/practitioner network.
The primary focus of this position is to build logical datasets from various sources, build/augment reporting functionality, develop systematic processes to routinely maintain and update data, and reduce variation across reporting platforms.
Experience Level: 5+ Years. Bachelors Degree Required

Skill Set:
Business analysis.
Business process modeling - enterprise to department level.
Ability to interpret Entity Relationship Diagrams.

1. Strong skills in SQL, SAS programming languages.
2. Demonstrated experience in gathering business requirements and execution of report and query design.
3. Experience with MS Access.
4. Ability to synthesize complex business/report requirements and connect them across efforts to anticipate reporting needs.

Desired Skills:
1. Experience with developing/implementing SQL Server solutions.

Soft Skills:
1. Strong written and verbal communication skills; demonstrated work experience with both business and technical teams.
2. Values teamwork; listens/responds constructively to needs of team members and stakeholders.
3. Demonstrates flexibility and openness to changes (sometimes last-minute) that need to be made in work products.
BUSINESS ANALYST SKILLS

Translates business and technical needs, issues, and ideas into effective strategies and action plans.
Elicits detailed business requirements and builds effective, data driven and analytical solutions to meet requirements (requires SQL, SAS, and integration from data from multiple db/file formats)
Formulates specific implementation plans and evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented.

Participates in the development of process improvements and related outcomes
Works closely with business, IT, and non-Clients partners
Very strong analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team.

TECHNICAL SKILLS

Experience with analytical manipulation and interpretation of large databases required.
Designs and enhances databases and alternative solutions.
Designs systems that are effective and user-friendly.
Conducts data analysis and develops reports with accurate, easy to read, useful information.
Designs and manages data quality tracking and monitoring tools.
Validates and maintains data integrity across multiple databases and data sources (SQL, internal SAS, DB2, VSAM; external: Adobe, Excel, SAS parsing routines, COBOL).
Builds and maintains statistical routines using macros, vendor software, and software written by self and others.

Top 3-5 Daily Responsibilities:
1. Identify business requirements for provider network data reporting needs; develop systematic/programmatic solutions based on business requirements.
2. Optimize existing database used to collect provider demographic data; design and implement additional existing databases, based on data management needs.
3. Identify solution options for more systematic intake of provider demographic data changes and updates.

Position Description:
Provide data architectural leadership in developing enterprise data/process models, and logical/physical database designs.
Provide data and database development, maintenance, and production support.
Participate in IT and Business project to define system requirements.
